campaign.story:
Brand new page and a new start!
Yes! We are finally back from deep winter sleep with the brand new account created specially for our team.
  What is "The Mines"?
"The Mines" is a series of printable miniatures and also a name of our team. 
"Flames of War" is a remake of the campaign, which was cancelled in October 2020. Since then almost everything has been redone and now we think it is ready for the public. 
 Please note, that we do not distribute physical copies of our products! Miniatures will be delivered as digital STL files. 
All miniatures have premade supports for 28mm scale and will be delivered via Kickstarter messages as .stl files.
 Ogres are big, strong, mostly unintelligent creatures. They live independent or in small groups near mountain slopes and prefer to hunt at night. 
 Models will be delivered via kickstarter messages as digital STL files. We test every model before delivery. Pre-supported versions will be included to the archive.   
Credits
We would like to thank all people, who helped us during creation process and provided us with useful information about the results of test prints. Also we specially want to thank those, who gave us examples of painted miniatures.
Animation in trailer was made using Unreal Engine 4 specially for "The Mines" series. We'd like to thank the developers of Unreal Engine for their outstanding job. 
If you have any questions please contact theminesecret@gmail.com

campaign.story:
Ghastly Graves is a set of stl files allowing you to build your own gothic themed graveyard.
Files have been scaled for 28mm miniatures but,  as with all 3D printable files, you have the ability to scale them up or down to suit your gaming needs. The headstones and monuments look great at a variety of sizes.

 You get stl files for the items below as well as any stretch goals that get unlocked during the course of the Kickstarter campaign.
NZ $1 - What's happening here?
Pledging one dollar will keep you up to date with what's going on and make you feel like a terrific person.
Approximately US $0.72, UK £0.52, Euro €0.60

 NZ $40 - The Ghastly Graves
This pledge level will get you all of the 'Ghastly Graves' files plus all the unlocked stretch goals.
Approximately US $28.92, UK £20.81, Euro €23.93



There are multiple stretch goals for this campaign that I'm itching to get unlocked and designed.

 NZ $500 - Unlocked! - Skull Dice
NZ $500 will see some skull themed dice unlocked. Just what you need for gaming in a graveyard.

NZ $1000 - Unlocked! - Broken Headstones
At NZ $1000 broken versions of the headstones will be unlocked. Not all headstones manage to stay intact over the years.

NZ $2000 - Unlocked! - Necronomicon and Lectern
At NZ $2000 an open and closed version of the Necronomicon and a Lectern will be unlocked.  It's good to have a place to read your evil books. 
NZ $3000 - Unlocked! - Broken Monuments
At NZ $3000 broken versions of the monuments will be unlocked.
NZ $4000 - Unlocked! - Jack o' lanterns
At NZ $4000 some Halloween style pumpkins will be unlocked.  Also called  Jack-o'-lanterns.
NZ $5000 - Unlocked! - Lychgate
At NZ $5000 A Lychgate for the graveyard will be unlocked.  Attaches to the fence that comes with the initial rewards.
NZ $6000 - Unlocked! - The Fancy Grave
NZ $6000 will unlock the Fancy Grave.  An even more impressive monument and gravestone, with a nice little surrounding wall will make this the fanciest grave in the whole yard.
NZ $7000 - Unlocked! - Alternate Gargoyle
At  NZ $7000 an alternate gargoyle will be unlocked.  Suitable for the mausoleum or Fence pillars
Griffin Gargoyle and Griffin Gargoyle on a fence pillar.

NZ $8000 - Unlocked! - Graveyard Well
A well, suitably gothic themed of course.
NZ $9000 - Unlocked! - Dark altar
NZ $9000 will unlock an altar for performing dark rites, raising the dead for instance.
NZ $10,000 - Unlocked! - Gallows
At NZ $10,000 a gallows will be unlocked. Not only will the graveyard house the dead but create them too!
NZ $12,000 - Unlocked! - Streetlamps
NZ $12,000 will unlock street lamps for the graveyard, useful for adventuring into the graveyard at night.

NZ $14,000 - Unlocked! - Creepy Tree
At NZ 14,000 a creepy tree will be unlocked.  A good place for crows to hang out.
NZ $16,000 - Unlocked! - Gibbet
At NZ $16,000 A gibbet, i.e. a hanging cage will be unlocked. This will hang from the creepy tree.
TBD - To be designed.

NZ $18,000 - Unlocked! - Fountain
NZ $18,000 will unlock a fountain for the graveyard,  useful for quenching ones thirst.  
NZ $20,000 - Unlocked! - Death Wagon
At NZ$20,000 a Death Wagon will be unlocked, useful for collecting and transporting the dead.
TBD - To be designed.

NZ $25,000 - Locked - Alternate Mausoleum top
NZ $25,000 will unlock an alternate top and new facades for the mausoleum. Great for differentiating one mausoleum from another.
TBD - To be designed.

NZ $30,000 - Locked - More to come
I've plenty more stretch goals to keep us going so watch this space.




 All files were printed using fdm printers (an Up Box + and an Ender 3 Pro) and used rafts and supports. They were designed using 3ds Max and ZBrush and have been run through a repair tool.

campaign.story:
Our last project: "Princesses got angry" saw the birth of many cute little sculptures and two fantasy football teams, but many other pieces deserved to be deepened and turned into whole teams.
So we decided to invest some time and realize this idea.
Using some of the sculptures from the project, we made 5 teams!
This is going to be a short kickstarter, we could almost call it a stretch goal of the previous one.

Let's go and introduce our teams!

Probably my favourite team, from the original design of the goldilocks bears, these 16 evil puppets were sculpted.
Ideal for playing as a Norse team!

Who doesn't love cats?
In our previous campaign there are no less than three cats, but this team comes from the miniature of Puss in Boots, we decided to make these cats in 1600's style clothes, between musketeers and Swiss Guards.
We decided to make an Imperial Nobility team, one of the last types of teams that came out.

it is not very difficult to understand from which sculpture these little fighters are born.
In the previous project we made the three little pigs as butchers, so we thought we would finish the team with the other members of the kitchen, cooks and chefs!
for this team we thought of adapting it to a team of Black Orc.
3 Additional Black Boars
even the ugly duckling didn't look peaceful, but now a whole team of squawking ducks will attack you with their uniforms.

This team can be used as an Elven Union.

Perhaps the craziest of the teams in this project!
We have already proposed these bunnies in different ways, and in our store you can find several of them, but this time these little rodents really look like demons!

A team made to be played as Chosen Chaos.
For each team, we decided to give away a "star player" sculpture from the previous campaign.
These are the models from which the inspiration for these teams came.

But not only these models will be free, but they will also be available immediately for download for all pledege even the 1€ ones.

You can find the download right away inside the first update!

We decided to make a doctor for each team! Free for each pledge!

And we are proud to have been the forerunners of this new technology and therefore also on this occasion we offer our sculptures in stl version ready for your 3D printer!

PLEASE NOTE - This Kickstarter is for digital files (STLs) to make all these items on your own home 3D printer - these are not physical goods **

Students at the Comics courses in Florence, made by the greebo games sculptures, they approached the world of miniatures. campaign.story:
Love the art? So do we. War Games was very fortunate to have partnered with the incredibly talented Justin Redmond of Red Revolt Design for this project, and we couldn't be happier with the way everything turned out. Check out the rest of Justin's work HERE 

Kicking Tables interview with OMG Nexus and our CEO, Justin Burgess
Board's Eye View 
"If you're looking for a fast, fun push-your-luck game with enough atmosphere to keep you argh-ing throughout its 30 minutes or so playing time, then Rolling Plunder is the treasure you've been craving. And tho', with dice rolling and card flipping, there's inevitably a high luck factor, there are enough opportunities for the calculating captain to play the odds."

 The Friendly Boardgamer- 
"Rolling Plunder is a small box card and dice game with straightforward rules that are easy to understand. Players start off with a small, basic ship that improves as the game goes on. Your ship stats determine how many re-rolls you get when pursuing the other ship. I really like the re-roll mechanism and it adds tension and a hint of push your luck when trying attempting to hunt down or defeat another ship. The higher your sail or cannon value the more re-rolls you get."

NRN Gaming- 
"Players can have a lot of fun trying to fight for ships that outclass them. If a player picks up a R.M.S. ship early in the game, going on offense pays off. You can also slowly build up your power while getting a complimentary crew, which seems to be the best “safe” strategy. “Zerg Rush” and defense are present, but less applicable in this game, thus Rolling Plunder earns a strong 7.5 strategy score."

Solitaire Times-
"The game takes place in the 18th century, and the goal is to upgrade your ship to a galleon and then earn more points than your opponents. In the solo mode, you win if you manage to upgrade your ship within 7 turns. After you shuffle the Crew, Ship, and Plunder decks, you place six Crew cards in the middle, face up. You begin with a hand of 2 Plunder cards, one sailor card as your starting crew, and a schooner as your starting ship."

WV Gamers-
"I really like the concept and the overall straightforward mechanics of the game. Who doesn't like a fun dice chucking pirate game where you are hunting ships, building up your ship and crew, and taking on the Royal Navy."

 Game Enthus 
 Aspie Gamer Girl 
Click here for a downloadable version of the rules!
Crowdfunding Innovation 
Stretch Goals
Once our first stretch goal is reached we'll open the next two levels, and our backers will get to chose which option they want to pursue. During the campaign each new level reached will unlock additional choices, all determined by YOU. The first is a custom 1st player marker with the Rolling Plunder and doubloon logo for marking turn order! 
Gameplay and Strategy
Rolling Plunder is a mechanically distinct game with a unique combat system. While your ship card's stats are used as the base, it avoids the "numbers win" problem of many games that causes an early lead to become a game-winning snowball effect. The dice rolling combat is balanced by the custom die faces, ships' attack and speed stats, and the interaction of Crew and Plunder cards so that players always have the chance to win a fight but a hard-earned advantage still means something.
There is also a social element that allows players to play each other as well as the game. Buy plunder from each other, trade captured ships for their Victory Points, form temporary alliances or truces... you can even save an enemy from an impending mutiny! Provided the price is right, of course.
Many cards have multiple uses and can be saved for defense or used to aggressively pursue a lead. Crew members provide set benefits every turn, or they can be sacrificed for a greater bonus at a key moment. "Unique Crew" members are stronger and more valuable, but each pirate can only have one at a time on his or her ship. The Unique Crew you choose can substantially change your play style or which risks you're willing to take. Just choose wisely, or your opponents will overtake you. In the end, only one pirate can become the greatest on the high seas.
More product information can be found @ WarGamesLLC.com



OUR TEAM (drawn by our kick-ass artist Justin Redmond)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With COVID-19 still sweeping the globe, the War Games team debated for a long time about whether or not to go live, and ultimately decided that this crisis wasn't going to beat us. However with a lot of people tightening their belts and wallets until the crisis is over, we were risking a failed campaign. So we decided that in addition to running the Kickstarter, we're going to give the digital game away for FREE to anyone who backs us, and they'll get the game immediately. So not only will backers be supporting a veteran-owned small business, but they will get the chance to play Rolling Plunder as soon as they join our campaign.

Even if we fail, we will have provided our game to the public and hopefully brought just a little bit of joy to their lives in tough times.

As for the product and campaign itself, Rolling Plunder will be our 4th Kickstarter and we will be applying the lessons learned from our past 3 successful projects (FUBAR, Blue Falcon, and WTF, Over?) to ensure Rolling Plunder goes above and beyond the high expectations we've already set with our previously satisfied backers.

Creatively, there is also the possibility that the pirate theme is not unique enough to keep interest in our concept. We have fought this by designing a game that is visually striking regardless of setting, while still being strategically interesting, mechanically unique, and accessible to serious and casual gamers alike.

campaign.story:
PLAY

Hello everyone, this time I bring you "Antediluvian-beasts", prehistoric animals that managed to develop after the great extinction of the Late Cretaceous.
Sixty-five million years ago. The impact of a colossal meteorite on the planet's surface ended the reign of the great dinosaurs.
Enabled this the development of other animal groups that occupied bacchante.
The birds and mammals evolved, reaching great size.
Terror birds, giant ground sloths, saber tooth, countless animal species came to dominate the planet and coexist with the first human beings.
The species represented in this campaign lived several million years ago, some species surviving until about eight thousand years ago.
The miniatures I have modeled respecting current paleontological knowledge by study fossil remains and take into account recognized paleo-artistic recreations.
My previous experience in this field helped me carry out this work. 
A few years ago, I had the opportunity to make life-size recreations of these fauna components.
 http://josejorgepereiro.blogspot.com/ 
 http://josejorgepereiro.blogspot.com/

I hope you like these miniatures either for display on your shelves or by engaging you in epic battles on the game table.
Colossal herbivores will fight for their lives, facing powerful and ruthless carnivores.
If you accompany me, you can be a lucky spectator, without taking any risk, good luck !!!
Eight antediluvian beasts with their respective bases represented in the core set:
-Megaterio (Megatherium americanum)
-Doedicuro (Doedicurus clavicaudatus)
-Fororraco(Phorusrhacos longissimus)
-Gonfoterio (Stegomastodon platensis)
-Saber-tooth (Smilodon populator)
-Toxodon (Toxodon platensis)
-Macrauquenia(Macrauchenia patachonica)
-Marsupial Saber-tooth (Thylacosmilus atrox)
 The miniatures were modeled on a 32mm scale (height of a man's eyes).
The bases of each piece go separately and have the common name of each species.

Pre Supported Models
 All the models in this campaign will be delivered Pre Supported so that you can enjoy your printed miniatures as soon as possible. You will receive the pieces in "clean" STL files, in STL files with the supports, and the Chitubox file in case you want to modify any of the supports.



MEGATERIO (Megatherium americanum) - The Megaterio was a giant ground sloth that could measure up to 6 meters and weigh 5 tons. Standing on its hind legs reaching, the branches high of the trees and feending on fruits and leaves. They were originally from South America. During Great American Biological Interchange (G.A.B.I.) some species migrated to North America shortly before their extinction eight thousand years ago.
DOEDICURO (Doedicurus clavicaudatus) - The Doedicuro was a great armadillo, 4 meters long, weighing 3 tons, belonging to the Glyptodonts group. It was a South American herbivorous slow. The current armadillos have an articulated carapace.Glyptodonts had rigid carapace. Its shell made it impregnable it also had a long tail provided by large spikes that served as an excellent defensive weapon.
FORORRACO (Phorusrhacos longissimus) - The Foorracos were giant birds belonging to the group of the so-called terror birds. They measured 2.5 meters and weighed 200 kg. They lived from 15 million years ago until their extinction approximately one million years ago. They inhabited Patagonia and were without a doubt the super-predators of those times. Their reign probably ended when saber-toothed cats from the northern hemisphere arrived in their territories.
GONFOTERIO (Stegomastodon platensis) - The Gonfoterios was proboscides extinct relatives of the present elephants. They are originating about 12 million years ago in the northern hemisphere and arriving in South America during the G.A.B.I. 1 million years ago, becoming extinct about eight thousand years ago.
SABER TOOTH (Smilodon populator) - Smilodon populator was the species most powerful of saber-toothed cats. They belonged to the extinct subfamily Machairodontinae, distantly related to current felines. They were originally from the northern hemisphere.From the formation of the Isthmus of Panama, colonized South America approximately 2 million years ago. Their distinguishing feature was their long upper canines. Laterally compressed like daggers would have been very effective in penetrating the tough skin of the large herbivore mammals of the ice age. These characteristics, although, effective would make them quite fragile, so the bite had to be very precise and do when the prey was immobile enough not to expose the teeth to possible breakage.
TOXODON (Toxodon platensis) - Toxodon platensis was a species belonging to the extinct order Notongulata. Exclusive to South America, Toxodon platensis originated during the Eocene 27 million years ago. It had two large rodent-like curved incisors and lower incisors arranged horizontally like a spatula, which allowed it to feed on tough grasses and shrubs. They became extinct about 10,000 years ago.
MACRAUQUENIA (Macrauchenia patachonica)- Macrauchenia was a large native South American mammals long-necked, and long-limbed, of three-toed of the disappeared order Litopterna. In life, Macrauchenia may have resembled a humpless camel, nevertheless like other, litopterns it is most closely related to the odd-toed ungulates (Perissodactyla), horses, donkeys, zebras, etc. The oldest fossils in the genus date to the late Miocene, around seven million years ago, and M. patachonica disappears at the end Pleistocene around 10,000 years ago. Charles Darwin discovered one specimen during the voyage of the Beagle. It fed on plants in a variety of environments across what is now South America.
MARSUPIAL SABER-TOOTH (Thylacosmilus atrox) Thylacosmilus atrox was a highly specialized carnivorous Marsupial species. It was the size of a modern mountain lion.Its large 15 cm long canines sat on a bony cheek present on the lower jaw when the mouth was closed. It was a South American super predator that reigned during the Miocene 7 million years ago until the saber-toothed cats arrived from the northern hemisphere, causing the extinction of these, incredible marsupials 2 million years ago.

 The first stretching goal was unlocked.
ENTELODON (Entelodon sp.) - They are known as: "hell pigs" were a group of extinct mammals related to modern artiodactyls (pigs, deer, sheep, etc.). They were the size of a large bull. They had formidable teeth with which they could hunt. They stayed marks from their teeth on the skulls of large Oligocene herbivores thirty million years ago. They dominated the plains of the northern hemisphere until their extinction 5 million years ago.
 The second stretching goal was unlocked.
INDRICOTHERIUM (Paraceratherium orgosense) It was the largest terrestrial mammal that ever existed. It reached 8 meters in height and weighed 15 tons. It was a relative of the Rhinos although, its conformation resembled a giant giraffe. It lived in southwestern China during the Oligocene 30 million years ago. Due to the dramatic climate change caused by the formation of the Himalayas, it became extinct during Miocene 16 million years ago.

3D Printable STL Miniatures and terrain for Role Playing Games, Tabletop, Wargames, or other RPG needs
IMPORTANT: This campaign is for a set of digital STL files, no physical products. Thank you very much for your interest in the project.
LAST WORLD - DINOSAURS is my seventh Kickstarter, This project consists of a set of miniature dinosaurs.
The inspiration for choosing this theme is thanks to my 5 year old niece, now she is very interested in the world of dinosaurs, I was making a clay Trex with her, and the childhood memories and passion that I think we all have for this prehistoric world, made me decide to finally get this kickstarter out.
You will receive the digital files. These models are ideal for resin printers, but also suitable for FDM printers.
These characters can be used in wargame games or to make your own made-up campaigns.
Here are the characters:
 All the characters have been modeled with the Zbrush 3D modeling program, I have been a digital modeler for 3 years.
This kickstarter focuses on creating a world and characters inspired by the prehistoric world. You will be able to create memorable adventures to produce in our fantasy tabletop and role-playing games.
If you love printing and collecting 3D printable figures and miniatures as much as I love sculpting them, this Kickstarter is definitely for you. With your support, we can unlock more and more figures.
What will you receive?
Each figure has been exported as a high quality STL file. The files are 100% scalable.
The commercial license is perpetual, for lifetime.

Hello everyone! My name is David R. Sainz, a sculptor at Adaevy Creations, and this is my first Kickstarter campaign , and my first approach to the world of miniatures as an artist.
This campaign focuses on characters inspired by the Innsmouth theme, the iconic village created by H. P. Lovecraft. All the miniatures are scaled 36mm with high detail, so you can print it in any scale you want.
IMPORTANT: This campaign is for a set of digital STL files, no physical products.

6 INVESTIGATORS
4 DEEP ONE HYBRIDS
2 DEEP ONES IN 2 POSITIONS (4 MODELS)
1 TENTACLE
(And 4 base models in three sizes)
All STL files will be checked for errors and printed (on a Phrozen Sonic Mini) before sending the download links. I will send two versions of each miniature, pre-supported (chitubox) and unsupported.
 Some miniatures will have two options, a solid piece and other cut pieces, so you can print the entire character, or print it by pieces. With the merchant reward you can sell prints of this collection in your shop. Any advice for improvement will be well received!
Thank you very much for your interest in the project!

campaign.story:
Clash of Deck is a card-based combat game for 1-2 players aged 8+ that plays in 30 minutes, created by Léandre Proust, with artwork from Studio Rexard, and published by Grammes Édition. Create your 8 unit army and battle other Lord-Sorcerers to destroy their Strongholds!
Clash of Deck is dead… Long lives Clash of Deck! Clash of Deck is a card game which has been played and tested by hundreds of players throughout its first year of existence, as a French version. The game was published in 2020 in an atypical form: cards you cut yourself from a folded sheet of cardboard. A new standalone expansion was published each month. 
Today, thanks to the feedback and support of its community of players, Clash of Deck takes off with a new edition, available in English. The game will have more conventional components, such as "real" cards, larger and of better quality, with a tuck box. 
The game will be fully translated in English and French! The rules and the FAQ are only available in PDF. Most of the game's content is language independent. German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, Korean, Portuguese (European), Portuguese (Brazil), Greek, Russian, Slovene, Japanese, Polish, Hebrew, Vietnamese, Hungarian, Arabic, Ukrainian, Filipino, Afrikaans, Swedish, Turkish, Serbian, Chinese, Catalan, Danish, Galician, Esperanto, Indonesian, Czech and Breton are already unlocked!
The tuck box is approximately 90x60x15 mm in size. The cards will be 56x87 mm in size and have round corners, with standard quality Blue Core 280 GSM. This is the material used for successful games such as Magic: The Gathering and Pokémon.
Unlock rewards by generating points. To generate points, at the rate of 1 point each: Fan on BoardGameGeek (641+462), #clashofdeck or #grammesedition on Instagram (75), Share on Facebook (523), Retweet on Twitter (343), Share / Like on Kicktraq (79).
Total (updated April 15) : 2123 points (ALL SOCIAL STRETCH GOALS HAVE BEEN UNLOCKED! CONGRATULATIONS!)
Only the Starter Kit is available in this reboot. The Starter Kit is FREE, in order to distribute it as widely as possible. This goal of this Kickstarter campaign is to introduce Clash of Deck to the whole word and to bring a community together around the game. If the Kickstarter campaign succeeds, we will then have the necessary dynamic to publish additional paid content on a regular basis, to enrich the game with: stand-alone expansions, additional modules, alternative game modes... 
                        ⬇️ Click on the image below to get a Rulebook in English ⬇️
                     ⬇️ Click on the image below for a free Print and Play demo kit ⬇️
             ⬇️ Click the image below to play Clash of Deck on TableTop Simulator ⬇️
Face off against another player and choose your format: Draft or Constructed. We recommend the Draft format for your first plays. Each turn, the players draft cards from a common deck to build themselves an efficient deck. For the Draft format, you only need one copy of the Starter Kit. The Constructed format is destined for experts who've mastered the game's mechanisms and the synergies brought by special abilities. Players build their own decks by choosing 10 cards among all the cards from the game. Their opponent will banish two of those cards at the beginning of the game, to form the final 8-cards deck. For the Constructed format, each player must have a copy of the Starter Kit.
Each player receives a “Watchtower/Stronghold” card. 
Place the 2 “Bridge” cards in the play area. 
Shuffle all the other cards into a draw pile. 
Then, reveal the top 4 cards of the draw pile. First, player A chooses 1 of the 4 available cards. Then, player B chooses 2 of the 3 remaining cards. Finally, player A takes the last remaining card. Repeat the operation, but this time, player B chooses the first card. Repeat until each player has 8 cards. Each player shuffles their cards, constituting their hand. They then place their “Watchtower” card in the leftmost place in their hand.
The player who crossed a bridge last becomes the first player. For their first turn, they begin the game with only 6 Mana.
Players play their turn one after another. A turn consists of 3 phases:
Phase 1 – Mana Regeneration:
The player gains as much Mana as the number of cards in their hand (including the “Watchtower/Stronghold” card). Mana is used to pay cards costs. The player can use it during phase 2.
Phase 2 – Summoning:
The player can spend the Mana gained during phase 1 to play cards from their hand. A player can only play the 4 leftmost cards in their hand (ignoring the “Watchtower / Stronghold” card). 
A card’s Mana cost is indicated in their upper left corner. Mana that isn’t spent during a turn is lost. A player cannot spend more Mana than they gained during their previous phase 1. The play area consists of two lanes. When playing a card, the player chooses in which lane to place it. 
Players only summon units in their respective Realm: player A places their card on the left of the “Bridge” cards and player B places their cards on the right of the “Bridge” cards. There is no limit to the number of cards in a lane. A summoned unit is placed from the player’s hand in the play area, face up, in the lane of their choice, behind their other units already in play. The card remains in play as long as it isn’t destroyed.
Phase 3 – Assault:
A unit has Health Points (HP), and an Attack Value (ATK). A unit cannot attack the turn it enters play. Each unit a player controls inflicts their ATK value to an opposing unit. Units automatically activate in a predetermined order: first the upper lane, from the unit further away from to the unit closest to the “Bridge”; then, the lower lane, from the unit further away from to the unit closest to the “Bridge”. 
When a unit suffers at least as much damage as its HP value, the unit is destroyed. It suffers the entirety of the damage caused by the attack and the card returns to its owner’s hand, in the rightmost place.
Then, move all the units on the lane closer to the “Bridge” so they fill the gap. Units regenerate their HP at the end of the turn. During an assault, a unit inflicts its ATK value to the closest opposing unit on the same lane. If no opposing unit can be attacked, the unit then inflicts its damage directly to the opponent’s “Watchtower/Stronghold”.
When a “Watchtower/Stronghold” suffers damage, shift it that many places to the right in the player’s hand. 
When a “Watchtower” reaches the rightmost place in a player hand, it is destroyed: flip it to its “Stronghold” side and return it to the leftmost place in the player’s hand. Excess damage inflicted to the “Watchtower” does not carry over to the “Stronghold”. When a “Stronghold” card reaches the rightmost place in a player’s hand, that player loses the game.
End of the game
The game ends as soon as a “Stronghold” card reaches the rightmost place in a player’s hand. Their opponent then wins the game.
The Solo Mode allows you to play Clash of Deck alone, through a Quick play or a Custom play.  Before playing custom games, we recommend you practice with a few Quick games to learn and discover the rules and the peculiarities of Clash of Deck’s solo mode. Fine-tune the AI difficulty level and try to reach level 5!  
The games will be sent from France in an envelope with an inside bubble wrap sheet for extra protection. You only pay for shipping, worldwide shipping for 2€! For each additional copy, please add 2€ to your pledge. Each additional copy can be sent to a different mailing address. Take the opportunity to offer a copy of the Starter Kit to your family, friends or colleagues!
There will be no Early Bird pledges or Stretch Goals for this campaign. However, the sipments will be processed in backer order, so the sooner you pledge, the sooner you will receive your reward. Shipping will begin in September 2021. We will not be using a Pledge Manager or allow Late Pledges at the end of this Kickstarter campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Léandre Proust has already launched and managed Kickstarter campaigns before (Cut and Play season 1 and season 2), and taken part in several Kickstarter and preorder campaigns when he was working as Responsable France for Lucky Duck Games. Although this is Grammes Édition's first boardgame publishing project, we already have solid knowledge about manufacturing boardgames and managing Kickstarter campaigns. We have taken great care when choosing our partners (translator, manufacturer). Despite establishing a realistic retroplanning, it is not impossible that we must face delays outside our control. But rest assured that, should it happen, we will keep you informed of the situation.

Refund policy

All pledges can be 100% refunded up to 14 days after the end of this funding campaign. No justification will be required. If the refund is asked for more than 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign, a 12.5% sum will be deducted from the amount (corresponding to Kickstarter and Stripe fees) and the refund will be issued through Paypal. No refund will be accepted after rewards are sent.

Terms and conditions

By pledging, you acknowledge and accept that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards are susceptible to change and may differ from what is displayed on this Kickstarter page. For France, VAT is included in your pledge. However, you are responsible for import duties and any other duty that may be payable to relevant tax authorities, by providing correct address information and by ensuring that said address can be delivered by normal methods.

campaign.story:
Here we are! In another crazy project!

Yes, this time the project is really peculiar!
In our family we have 4 nieces and of course they are super in love with princesses, and various fairy tales, that they make us read or see on repeat!

At a certain point we asked ourselves what would happen if the princesses weren't so sweet and cute anymore, but they would get angry and go crazy?

And here is the result!

In addotion we discovered that the classic fairy tales, the original ones, are anything but cheerful, they are dark and disturbing!
Another good reason for our girls to go crazy!

By now 3D miniatures are an established reality.
When in 2017 we launched the first kickstarter with this formula many called us heretics, avant-gardists and dreamers.

Today, just 4 years later, it is a widespread market and a reality that is increasingly entering people's homes.

And we are proud to have been the forerunners of this new technology and therefore also on this occasion we offer our sculptures in stl version ready for your 3D printer!

PLEASE NOTE - This Kickstarter is for digital files (STLs) to make all these items on your own home 3D printer - these are not physical goods **

All models have been presupported (where necessary)
Several printing tests have been carried out to get the Best result possible, and we hope that you will also get an optimal result with your printers.

cross lances is committed, as always, to solving any problem you may encounter in printing, fixing the files and creating together with you an ever-improving product.
Also this project has many sculptures and many varieties: we thought to satisfy as many people as possible: from collectors who love to print their miniature in resin and paint it, from fantasy football players who in recent years have often supported us, and also to those who are dedicated to filament printing and love scenery and decorative elements.

So let's go to present all our sculptures!

The first set is about Alice's fantastic adventure in Wonderland!

We decided to accompany it with three classic characters: cheshire cat , queen of hearts and mad hatter.


Here we introduce a new famous fairy tale: Beauty and the Beast.
It seems that its origin is inspired by an event that really happened in Italy, in Viterbo in 1550.
But then various versions have followed in history.


Sleeping Beauty is another classic fairy tale that has been passed down through time and come down to us.
We have documented a bit on the history of this fairy tale, and the first versions are anything but cheerful, indeed they are very disturbing and not suitable for children, if you are curious I recommend you to document and you will be amazed, and perhaps horrified



Little Red Riding Hood

It's not a princess, no that's true, but it's perhaps the most famous fairy tale of all!

This story also underwent several changes in the story going to cut very bad scenes and inserting a happy ending.
In the past the stories didn't end very well I would say....
From what we have been able to learn, this is the oldest fable that we are going to discuss.
It seems in fact that the origins date back even to the Egyptians, and over three hundred versions have been made in history.
Traveling around the world has collected variants from China, Persia, Russia, England and who knows how many others up to the present day.

Another traditional fairy tale.
This time the origins are Danish and we can say that it has more recent origins, in fact it was published for the first time in 1837.
But even here the story is a little different from what we remember, and the ending is rather sad.

This story has also undergone numerous variations over time and has traveled throughout Europe, there are many ways in which the prince becomes human again.

The most famous is surely, as often happens, the one created by the Grimm brothers.


Rapunzel is another classic in the history of fairy tales.
The myth of the maiden locked in the tower has its origins in ancient Greece with the mythological figure of Danae.
But it seems that the true origins of the story come from Italy from a racocnto of 1634.
Also here multiple versions and variations, some more alelgre, others decidedly less happy.

And here's the prince!
Yes, because in every good fairy tale there is a prince!
But we wanted to interpret him in a nice way:
Going to know more about the classic fairy tales and how they have evolved in history we discovered that these princes were often not so beautiful, good and kind.
So we imagined that the princesses got in the way of the prince in revenge for his misdeeds, and he was put to "work".

Hoping this is nice and doesn't offend anyone!


We decided to dedicate a small area also to lovers of scenic and filament printing.

We created this castle, partly modular, in fact you can freely assemble the pieces in order to create the composition you prefer.

The castle is in fact composed of 16 elements!

inspired by the most famous fairy-tale castles in northern Europe.



We said we would make a small dedication to our Fantasy Football supporters as well and here it is!

Sculpting the seven dwarves from Snow White we realized that a team of dwarves with this design would be beautiful!

During our kickstarters we are used to unlock many add-ons.
We generally ask our backers what they would like to see within the campaign and try to make it happen.
Usually we get a lot of suggestions and not all of them can be realized, but we will try our best this time!

In addition we have already preset some small goals that will be unlocked as the campaign progresses!


first add-on unlocked!

Pumpkin carriage.
Maybe it would have been better on halloween but we liked carving it anyway.

Inside we left it open for those who wish to turn it into a lamp.

This time it's Sissi's turn, when we talk about princesses, we can't help but think of her, even if she doesn't belong to a traditional fairy tale but is a historical character who really existed.

Here is our interpretation of Princess Sissi!

Another add-on unlocked!
100 backers.
Awesome!

Here is the dice throwing tower!

Thanks again, this add-on has also been unlocked.

this time it's up to another character from the famous novel "alice in wonderland".

Here is the white rabbit!

We went to sculpt another of the most famous princesses: the princess on a pea!

We have made another of the most famous fairy tales in the world: the three little pigs!

Okay, they're not exactly princely, but we think they might like it! 
Also this time we have moved away from the world of princesses, but it is a fairy tale that is very close to our heart, from the tales of Collodi here is Pinocchio and the Turquoise Fairy!

We promised more surprises for fantasy football lovers and here it is!

A whole new team made of many little pinocchios.
We really liked the pinocchio sculpture so much that we decided to make a whole team.
With the addition of a fire-eater!
We hope you like it too!
What would a fairy tale be without a dragon?
And finally here it is for you, all our princesses (but not only) without weapons.
During the campaign at the same time we will release three more miniatures related to the project.
You can find them on our patreon and make them yours with only 1 euro!
https://www.patreon.com/crosslances
So don't miss this funny scene of Hansel and Gretel cooking the witch!
The roles are reversed!
These miniatures are not available on the kickstarter!
We would also like to point out our "Print and Paint" contest.
With 20% cupon spendable on our store.

With expiration date Sunday 14!

How to participate?

By buying the rights of these files you will be allowed to:
- print the 3D miniatures

campaign.story:
Introducing a precisely digitally hand-recreated reproduction of the next Cotta's almanac deck full of history, and for the fourth time, strongly touched by Schiller's works, continuing after the previous yellow, green, and the blue one, which was the first published complete transformation playing card deck in the world!
The red "Turandot" deck is the fourth in a series of six famous transformation playing card decks we plan to release... This fourth Cotta's almanac playing cards deck was originally published in 1809. There is no known evidence of any deck issued in 1808, and so this red almanac issued in 1809 is considered to be the fourth in a series.
Court card figures depict Arabs in various costumes, which could have been taken from sources of the seven climes (Persia, China/Turkestan, Khwârazm, Slavonia, North Africa, Byzantium, and India), which as well adds another historical value to its rarity. 
Additionally to the series of Cotta's almanac decks, all influenced by notable authors, this one might also draw on aspects from another Schiller's work - especially the translation and his intriguing epic symbolic adaptation of Turandot, the famous commedia dell'arte (Italian comedy) play by Count Carlo Gozzi from 1762 after and originated in supposedly Persian story of Calaf's adventure in the theme of the Arabic and Persian tales from the collection (Thousand and One Day) Les Mille et un jours (1710–1712) by François Pétis de la Croix.   
The artwork also may have been inspired by the Arab population that migrated to Germany or even studied in Tübingen where the Cotta's publishing house was founded. But mostly there was a friendship between Schiller, Goethe, Cotta, and Gozzi, who died in 1806, a year after Schiller in 1805, what might have been the true impulse.
"Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck)
Features:
Printed by USPCC on Classic Stock
Poker Size
Embossed (Linen) Finish 
52 Cards + 2 Extra 17th-century Jokers + 2 Extra Collectible 16th-century Art Cards 
Metallic Ink On Box & Card Backs (Both Versions of Tucks and Card Backs inside) 
Custom Seals - Numbered and Standard 
Puzzle Image on all Tuck Spines of the Series (Inking Vary by Tuck Version) 
Digitally Hand-Recreated and Designed by Azured Ox
Produced By Will Roya
After the success of the first blue 1805, the second green 1806, and the third yellow 1807 Cotta's almanac decks, again we come with two versions of the fourth red 1809 Cotta's deck limited edition - the "Numbered" and the "Standard".
As campaigns before, we are limiting this 4th "Numbered" deck to only 1,000 copies of tuck which is the whole gold-inked with custom numbered seals. Additional "Standard" limited edition decks are created just with a slight difference on tuck designed with dark and gold ink combination and the same custom seals (non-numbered). Both versions will include the same gold metallic inked card back design inside of the tuck box.
There are many historical values in the series of decks...
That's why the entire 6 deck series is in many ways designed by Azured Ox to meet collector's demand as a "collection of historical books" with their mysteries and secrets hidden inside up to your findings...
Series of decks will be produced with the piece of puzzle image on each tuck "book" spine (left side of the box) to create together a nice display of the Tuebingen monument surroundings, where the idea for Cotta's decks was born.
Puzzle Spine Image "Digital Demonstration" to present Ink Combinations of Both Tuck Versions
If you are interested in more information about historical details with a profound and beautiful story behind Cotta's Almanac playing cards creation and idea, or about the famous and noble people connected to these unique transformation playing card decks, you can find reading after scrolling down this project page.
The design of both versions of Cotta's limited edition tuck boxes, the standard and the numbered, created by Azured Ox, have been inspired by the old books and published writers' work using the gold ink on their covers as well as combined with the dark ink. 
Inking and Tuck Design Inspired by Old Books
Unexplained stories, hidden mysteries, secrets...
Much of historical happenings, influences, and activities would find a place in the Cotta decks, including events in the life of Cotta's own family and notable figures like Schiller and Goethe. Other important influences include the literature, art, history, politics (e.g. Napoleon's invasion), and religious reforms of the time, which all served as an important context to shape the art in the decks themselves...
4th almanac deck: "Arabic Turandot" (Year 1809) 
After the first blue deck themed on Joan of Arc play by Schiller, the second green deck themed on Jean Racine's plays, which were translated into the German language by Schiller, and the third yellow deck themed on Wallenstein, here in the fourth red deck, again the images on the court cards might be the characters somehow connected to another Schiller's translational work (1801), the Turandot by Count Carlo Gozzi from 1762, and so those Arabs displayed on court cards might be deeply inspired by Schiller's reverse thinking about the Turandot tale's true origin, as up to the present day, this play in its variety of settlements is considered as an enigma since original ideas were mostly filtered through many versions and their translated adaptations around the world over time.
"Nizami Ganjavi" Jamal ad-Dīn Abū Muḥammad Ilyās ibn-Yūsuf ibn-Zakkī is considered the greatest romantic epic poet in Persian literature, who brought a colloquial and realistic style to the epic.
Court card figures depict Arabs in various costumes, which could have been taken from sources of the seven climes (Persia, China/Turkestan, Khwârazm, Slavonia, North Africa, Byzantium, and India), which adds another historical value to its rarity. These seven climes may stretch back into the old stories, which are eventually also linked as a source idea for Turandot anecdote - Persian masterpiece Seven Beauties, by the Persian "wisdom" poet Nezami (died 1209) who recounts the romantic history of the pre-Islamic Persian king Bahram. The story of his journey from "black to white" also refers to Bahram’s spiritual development from darkness and ignorance to light and illumination, uniting himself with the source of light. He grows to a Perfect Man and an ideal king.
The plot of this story is very complex but significantly filled with mathematical, astronomical, cosmogonic, medical, spiritual, and mystical symbolism, which is surely interesting background for playing cards and their purposely hidden deep meanings...
And why Arabs? Turandot = Turan's daughter 
(The name derives from the Persian compound name Turan and dokht, meaning the daughter of Turan. Dokht is a shortened form of dokhtar or "daughter", "girl". As Persian belongs to the Indo-European family of languages, the word dokhtar has cognates in European languages. Turan refers to the northeastern borders of Persia. Turandot recounts the story of a Turkestan/Chinese princess who kills her suitors when they fail to decipher riddles.)
Additionally to the series of Cotta's almanac decks, all influenced by notable authors and works, it is more than likely, just by continuing pattern, that even this 4th red deck might also draw on aspects from another Schiller's work - especially as mentioned above, the Schiller's translation and his intriguing epic symbolic adaptation of Turandot, the famous commedia dell'arte (Italian comedy) play by Count Carlo Gozzi from 1762 after and originated in supposedly Persian story of Calaf's adventure in the theme of the Arabic and Persian tales from the collection (Thousand and One Day) Les Mille et un jours (1710–1712) translated from Persian original by François Pétis de la Croix.
Count Carlo Gozzi (13 December 1720 – 4 April 1806)
There is also evidence of the first theatre premiere of Schiller's adaptation of Turandot in 1802, specifically at the "old" Weimar Hoftheater by Johann von Goethe, who had been the theatre's director since its inception in 1791. Schiller had begun a collaborative friendship with Goethe in 1794 which lasted until Schiller's death in 1805, after which Goethe forsook ballads and turned to the completion of Part one of Faust, as well as the Cotta's almanac deck series, started in 1805, marked and influenced by these significant occurrences, and then even Gozzi's death came about a year after in 1806, and this deck's theme might be the tribute to Gozzi.
(If you are interested in more info about Schiller, Goethe, and Cotta's relation to this series of Cotta's decks, you might scroll down to read in the part of "Story About".)
"Réba Roi Arabe" (Lettered on King of Spades Court Card)
It's not all just about Schiller's famous works...
As the first blue and the second green and the third yellow deck before, also this fourth red deck was threaded by majestic and noble roots... Besides the noble publisher of the deck, Johann Friedrich Cotta, again there was another person involved in the graphical part of this deck creation.
Johann Friedrich Cotta (April 27, 1764 - December 29, 1832)
For the fourth time, again, cards were designed and stipple engraved by Countess Mary Day von Jennison-Walworth (sometimes spelled with a single 'n'). Her maiden name was Beauclerk, and she was the wife of Count Francis Jenison Walworth (1764–1824).
Probably, she was creating illustrations for decks in Stuttgart as detected from letter communication addressed to her mother in Britain that contained writings about the Cotta's decks... Her mother was Lady Diana Beauclerk (née Lady Diana Spencer; other married names Diana St John, Viscountess Bolingbroke; 24 March 1734 – 1 August 1808). Also, there in those letters is a mention about her mother's health failing what later resulted in a fatality, which probably might have been the main reason for the missing Cotta's almanac deck right for the year 1808 of the series. 
Six Unique Different Card Back Patterns Designed, with Regard to Card Handling, Individually for Each of the Cotta's Deck Year Almanacs.
Classic Style Borderless Full-Bleed Card Back Design with Luxury Feeling and Metallic Ink
The Same Gold Metallic Ink Card Back Design for Both Editions of the Cotta's Deck
Aces
Spades
Diamonds
Clubs
Hearts
In contrast to previous Cotta's decks' issues where the court cards were designated with the words "Valet", "Dame", and "Roi", which are the French terms corresponding to the Jack, Queen, and King, here the court cards of this 4th issue, Jack and Queen are not described, only King is described as "Roi".
Among all courts, the only single named figure of King Réba, the Midianite King of East, is represented as the King of Spades.
Jack of Spades - African
Queen of Spades - Noblewoman 
King of Spades - King Reba*
*Reba was one of five Midianite kings (Eʹvi, Reʹkem, Zur, Hur, and Reʹba) killed during the time of Moses by an Israelite expedition led by Phinehas, who was the grandson of Aaron (the elder brother of Moses) and the son of priest Eleazar (nephew of Moses), according to Numbers 31:8 and Joshua 13:21.
Jack of Hearts - Merchant 
Queen of Hearts - Noblewoman in ordinary home dress 
King of Hearts - Regalia Nobleman
Jack of Clubs - Ordinary man 
Queen of Clubs - Countrywoman 
King of Clubs - African
Jack of Diamonds - Infantryman 
Queen of Diamonds - Maiden in summer dress 
King of Diamonds - Nobleman
At last, we came with an idea to reflect the opposite of noble life and to bring closer to you even more of the unique artistic history placed on extra collectible playing cards...
Also, we thought it could be interesting to put other illustrations from the far past on the additional extra cards, in respect to year almanacs, we came with an idea of twelve calendar months in the series as an exclusive collection of unique historical artworks...
With the Elements of Heraldic Achievement...
Includes heraldry symbols connected with the family and past of the noble designer countess Jenison von Walworth who created most of the Cotta's decks...
An absolutely original playing card masterpiece to hang on your wall (double-sided)

Since this 4th deck's theme might be mostly inspired by the work of Count Carlo Gozzi, Schiller's translational work on Gozzi's Turandot, and even their friendship behind, this 4th deck might have been issued as a tribute to Gozzi, who died on April 4th, 1806, a year after Schiller, so we set symbolically end date of this 4th Cotta's deck project just to this memorial event...
Charming beginning of "Karten Almanach" series
The story behind these playing cards, which probably conceal most of the world's playing card secrets, begins in Tübingen, a city in southwest Germany.
The idea behind the concept of Cotta's transformation decks was to create a series of six decks on an annual basis from 1805-1811. Each deck would focus on a different theme...
Forming a "Card Almanac" (Karten Almanach), each card in the deck would represent one of the 52 weeks in a calendar year. At the time it was popular to print various almanacs, which were special pocketbooks for the new year, and often included a short poem or quote for each week of the calendar year. It was a logical move to connect each of these 52 weeks with playing cards.
Original illustrations were fiddling artworks - manually stipple engraved & etched on copper plates
 The famous Cotta's publishing house... 
The friendship that gave birth to the idea of Cotta's transformation playing card almanac decks...
The color of each tuck box created by Azured Ox has been inspired by Goethe's experimental optic and color theory, since Goethe was an important contemporary of Cotta, along with Schiller. (Goethe's deepest immersion into colors was during Cotta's decks issuing.)

campaign.story:
Welcome to "Beasts and Baddies" from EC3D, your one-stop shop for the fastest, easiest to print, and highly-reusable tabletop fantasy mini STLS!
This campaign was designed with a few goals in mind:

#1 - Give DMs and gamers a beautiful set of minis to cover the bases for MANY common beasts and baddies they might encounter across most games (particularly low-to-medium level ones)
#2 - Make those minis DEAD SIMPLE to print - no supports required on resin or FDM printers.
#3 - Design those minis so they can be painted fast, but detailed enough to paint to a high quality if you wish.
#4 - Make those minis resilient - aka less prone to breakage with small pieces, easy to travel with, survive drops on the floor, etc

Thus this campaign was born! Many Patreons and Kickstarters have crazy good looking sculpts of various huge bosses, or overly fragile dynamically posed monsters - but nobody is designing minis for the working DM, who wants to throw a set of monsters on the printer before work, come home and they are sitting there finished (with no print errors), slap some paint on them quick, and use them in tonight's session.
This Kickstarter is designed for every DM - regardless of what kind of fantasy game you run, what kind of printer you have, or what kind of models you are looking to fill out your ranks with, this campaign will have something for you. We have sets of all your basic monsters (orcs, goblins, gnolls, kobolds, undead, etc) plus MANY stretch goals planned out, with a backer voting to help add even more stuff to the pledge.

These minis are designed for your standard fantasy game, and are scaled ~32mm with somewhat heroic proportions. They'll look great next to your existing 3D printable figs, HeroForge, Reaper Bones, etc.
Minis are designed to print with zero slicer supports - just drop it on your build plate and print away.  Each mini is provided unbased, based on a simple flat base (for you to decorate to your own liking), and also based on a "quick release" bevelled and channeled base (for resin printing, which makes removal from the build plate easy).
In addition to carefully modeling designs to be support free, we have another advantage: I am a software engineer by trade, and developed an algorithm to help check and remove overhangs in the modeling/repair process, which leads to even easier to print minis!
This campaign is easy to understand. There is one pledge level, and it gets you everything pictured on this page! All the minis below are included with your pledge. These minis will be delivered to you as  STL files, with all the base options noted above. I've also release a ton of BASES , and am working on another free base pack for this campaign you can use to base these minis if you want more decorative bases.
As new stretch goals are unlocked, I'll add them to the list of included minis below.  There's 31 minis in the core pack, and I'm expecting to have nearly 100 minis in this campaign when all is said and done!

** PLEASE NOTE - This Kickstarter is for digital files (STLs) to make all these items on your own home 3D printer - these are not physical goods **
To see a high-res gallery of zoomable renders of each model shown, CLICK HERE
 \

Every $1k we hit in funding, I'll choose, at random, a current backer. That backer will pick a set in the list above, then I'll roll a d4 and whichever tier I roll will be unlocked! If I roll a tier already unlocked for a set, I'll re-roll. "Backer vote" means we'll do a 48 hr vote to unlock a mini, "Backer Pick" means that backer will choose a mini to add to the campaign (based on my discretion of course). Everybody loves free stuff, right?! EC3D has many many awesome minis over the years, and we remastered some from past campaigns to include as bonus items for this campaign - all backers will also receive the minis listed below, and I might add more during the campaign:
My name is Evan Carothers, and I am a 3D designer with hundreds of designs released via Thingiverse (ecaroth) and through my premium design company (EC3D). This is my 9th Kickstarter, and any of my thousands of customers can tell you about my track record of easy-to-print models - delivered on time. My skill and love for design has grown out of my passion for tabletop gaming, technology, and 3D printing. I design a  ton of the content myself and work with many other great designers and artists to put these projects together. Take a look at the quality of my free items on Thingiverse or my last campaigns Wilds of Wintertide,  Depths of Savage Atoll or Empire of Scorching Sands to get a feel for my design aesthetic, or check out some customer reviews. I am a tabletop gamer at heart, and all models are  printed, and often painted, by myself before being released.

Participating Modelers, Artists, Painters, and Printers
Credit to these awesome folks who helped this all come together!
Joshua Black (lead 3D character design),  Ulises Virgen (3D character design),  Sebastiano Di Grazia (3D character design), Ryan Calhoun (Cephalopod Studios, painting), Ruslan Ahmatnurov (concept art), and Jean Roux (art)
And a SPECIAL thank you to my wonderful wife Ally who has been unbelievably helpful, and essential in preparing this campaign!

Add-Ons

Add-ons allow you to get additional awesome stuff at a great discount, and help push even further to unlock stretch goals! There's tons of sets (including fantasy, sci-fi, and space-combat scale) with hundreds more miniatures and lots of terrain/scenery.
To get add-ons, just increase your pledge level by the amount indicated for whichever add-ons you would like. Once the KS closes I will be using a pledge manager (BackerKit) to help you finalize you add-ons. You can increase you pledge on KS now to help fund stretch goals, or get these after the campaign closes.
To add any STL stretch goals you must back the campaign at a level that includes STLs.

 Empire of Scorching Sands: My last sprawling campaign, featuring Arabian/Persian/Egyptian/desert terrain/scatter, monsters, and minis - Empire of Scorching Sands - the add-ons are equivalent to the what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain/scatter only ($20 add-on), Minis only ($20 add-on), or ALL IN ($30 add-on).
 Wilds of Wintertide: A chilly, northern project featuring icy, arctic tundra, terrain/scatter, monsters, and minis - Wilds of Wintertide - the add-ons are equivalent to the what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain/scatter only ($18 add-on), Minis only ($18 add-on), or ALL IN ($25 add-on).
 A Den of Alien Evil - Everything from the first volume of my "Community (Treasure)Chest" series - Mind Horror scenery, terrain, and minis. Check it out the content from the original campaign HERE ($10 add-on).
 Secret of the Crimson Troupe - Everything from the second volume of my "Community (Treasure)Chest" series - A wandering troupe with a dark secret! Check it out the content from the original campaign HERE ($15 add-on).
 The Holy Order of Ash - Everything from the third volume of my "Community (Treasure)Chest" series - A dark holy order! Check it out the content from the original campaign HERE ($15 add-on).
 Depths of Savage Atoll: A sprawling campaign, featuring nautical, jungle, pirate, and undersea minis and environs - Depths of Save Atoll - the add-ons are equivalent to the what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain/scatter only ($35 add-on), Minis only ($35 add-on), or ALL IN ($65 add-on).
 Skyless Realms: The races and places below the surface, from my previous campaign Skyless Realms  - the add-ons are equivalent to what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain only ($40 add-on), Minis only ($35 add-on), or ALL IN ($55 add-on).
 Novus Landing - My most recent 3D printable Kickstarter, full of scifi goodness! The add-ons are is equivalent to what's included in all-in pledge level of Novus Landing, (including unlocked stretch goals): Minis, Terrain/Scatter, or Vehicles (1 set for $25) or ALL IN (all 3 sets for $50)
 The Terra Conflict - My most recent 3D printable Kickstarter, full of space-combat scale ships, creatures, terrain, and more for epic space battles and encounters. This add-on is equivalent to what's included in the '3D Printable STL Files' pledge level of The Terra Conflict, including unlocked stretch goals ($30 add-on for the base set, and $42 for the base set + both add-on fleets).
 The Ignis Quadrant: My first foray into scifi, featuring support-free minis, tons of vehicles and lots of scatter terrain for all your scifi RPG and wargaming needs! The Ignis Quadrant - The add-ons are is equivalent to what's included in all-in pledge level, (including unlocked stretch goals): Minis, Terrain/Scatter, or Vehicles (1 set for $25) or ALL IN (all 3 sets for $50).
 Forest of Oakenspire - Everything from the core reward and stretch goals from my first Kickstarter Forest of Oakenspire at a great discount ($40 add-on).
 All EC3D Premium Sets - The full collection of all 12 previously released premium sets - over $100 value, as seen for sale on Hero's Hoard ($50 add-on)
 Individual EC3D Premium Sets - Chose any number of my EC3D scenery sets from my previously released premium set collection - substantial value over retail price, as seen for sale on Hero's Hoard ($5 per-set add-on)
** Please note ** - all the add-on items above can be purchased right now for a higher price on heroshoard.com or late pledge pages for those campaigns, but if you are willing to wait until this campaign closes to receive the files you can get a great discount AND help unlock more stuff for this current campaign.

Commercial and Resale

I have an official licensed printer program for my 3D sets, along with my partner at Hero's Hoard, which allows commercial physical resellers with a 10% commission on sales. Anybody can signup for that license, and sell the models from this campaign under that license, and I will not be doing specific merchant tiers for this campaign. So to sell these files (and other non-exclusive EC3D sets) you just need to signup for that resale program and back this campaign to receive the files.

Accountability
Everybody hates waiting, and many people have been burned by poorly designed files and broken delivery timelines in previous kickstarters from other vendors. This is not the case with my campaigns. All core models, and many stretch goals, area already finalized and test printed - and the majority of files will be ready for delivery the second the funds clear after the Kickstarter finishes (usually 2 weeks after the date the campaign ends). I will be finalizing and releasing the remaining items as fast as humanly possible, with a goal of 90 days *MAX* after this Kickstarter ends for delivery - which is something I have successfully done for all my previous Kickstarters. 

Disclaimer & Printing Requirements
To get the most out of the printable parts from this Kickstarter, you will need to have a well-tuned 3D printer. All minis are designed for FDM or resin printing, and will fit on the print beds of 99% of commercially-available at-home printers.
Every part is test printed by myself and repaired to be manifold and ready to drop on your slicer - however, In the event that any issues with the files get past my own QA testing and process, and my other test printers, I will make every effort to fix the file and remedy the situation as soon as possible. I use Dropbox for file delivery so I can push updates/fixes. My number one goal is to make some awesome, unique designs you can have a ton of fun with on your tabletop!

updates.update_content:
Hi folks, hope you're all well!
I just uploaded the final finished model this last weekend. At this point all the models are uploaded to the Dropbox and finished! There have also been tweaks to a few models that had previously been uploaded, all of which is logged and indicated in the REWARDS SPREADSHEET.
I'm sure there will be a few more tweaks needed, so I'm guessing I'll end up uploading a few more versions of some files as folks continue to print, but as of now this project is considered complete. Don't feel any rush to download though, the access/Dropbox will be available for a long time (I say at least a year, but in reality it will pretty much be in perpetuity).

Hey folks! Wanted to give you a quick update on Dropbox issues that occurred over the weekend.
At this point, all issues should be resolved thankfully and all access (including to add-on downloads) has been restored, and I have *lots* of bandwidth to work with at this point so you should be able to download to your heart's content! Sorry again for all the troubles!
I was also made aware that the Orcs were missing from the Dropbox, which was a mistake an I just uploaded them as well. The good news is that we should be churning out the remainder of the minis over the next 1-2 weeks and delivery of this project will wrap up really fast. Cheers!

Well, you think a 10 billion dollar company like Dropbox would have support people around to assist customers on weekends, but alas - they do not. Despite all my best efforts to sort out the locked share link fiasco preventing backers from accessing rewards, I have received no help from Dropbox.
I have ~150gb of files in shared links across all my 15+ projects which I use to power distributions for all my kickstarters, addons and deliverables - so there's no good short-term solution to remedying the access issues across all files.

Hi folks! Despite some trial and tribulation with Dropbox, I'm working hard to get the files for the KS and addons in your hands.  I apologize for the hiccups on delivery - this is my 11th Kickstarter, and I've learned one lesson as truth at this point - each one has *something* that goes wrong, so I apologize!
 Please take the time to watch the quick video below if you have any questions, or are new to my Kickstarters, as it explains how BackerKit and file access works.

Well, after 5+ years of successfully using, and being a fan of, Dropbox I've finally run into a snag with their service. This was one of my largest releases to date so far, and between the massive amount of uploads I did yesterday and the downloads, my account was flagged for high traffic and share links were blocked - DOH!
I'm working with their support team to resolved, but they told me there's a good chance it can take up to 24 hrs which is a huge bummer, but I'm crossing my fingers that it's much less than that. This affects all my downloads (addons and Beast and Baddies rewards) so I'm super sorry for the service interruption, but I'm working hard on my end to get things resolved, so stay tuned!

HEYO folks, hope you're all doing well! I've been doing my best to recover from being sick the last few days but have some news/updates to share:
 Model Updates 
I had to do work to nail down a backer for the final pick (I learned through this campaign that Kickstarter doesn't always send messages to backers when you send them,  particularly if the backer is primarily using the mobile app) so that caused some delays, but it's sorted. The final model that was chosen was the WRAITH - which is ironic, considering that is the absolute first model we made when we started on this campaign many months ago, so I' super glad it was included!

Hey folks! The team has been hard at work and we have some new renders to show you! We went classic for the young dragon (red) and you can see him in his fire-breathing glory below! Also another stretch goal added to the campaign was the Banshee. Next up is the finished (and F*$!ng EPIC) Roc. Lastly, the evil wizard busts on the scene to plague your players.
There's ONE stretch goal pick remaining to be unveiled - I didn't hear from the backer and did a new backer pick this morning, so stay tuned for that.

Hi folks! We're hard at work over here workin on more models to show you. We should have a render of the young dragon to show in the next few days, and we're working on the Evil Wizard and the Undead Croc too!
Two of the 4 picks that happened after the KS ended have been sorted, and the Roc and the Giant Rat have been added to the mix! You can see our concept art of the roc below (which will get tweaked to be supportless, of course). There's still 2 more picks coming your way too. Below you can see the finished renders of the Rust Monster, Giant Rat, and the finished pair of Slaad!

Thank you all so much for an awesome, successful campaign! We unlocked tons of stretch goals and this campaign evolved into a huge set of STLs that I'm proud to share with you all!
I wanted to take a minute to outline next steps for those of you who have never participated in one of my Kickstarters before, and answer a few common questions!
