So with around 24 hours left in this campaign, I wanted to reach out and apologize for the lack of updates and to address a few things. Sadly due to things out of my control, I have been unable to really promote and get the following necessary to make this a successful Kickstarter campaign. I have had many things happen that just did not allow me to dedicate the time and energy necessary, and I just wanted to formally apologize to the few backers that I do have. I do have some good news though, I will still be undertaking the production of Project Astrala, along with some newer projects that I hope will be a big hit as well. This Kickstarter may have failed, but I did still receive a ton of interest outside of Kickstarter. So here is the deal, I will be setting up kind of a pre-order list for those still interested in purchasing a Project Astrala, so if anyone is still interested, just email me at emeraru.audio3d@gmail.com
I appreciate all the Backers that have contributed so far, and I am looking forward to reaching my funding goal and getting Project Astrala out and onto the market for everyone to enjoy.

campaign.story:
Hey Kickstarter, it’s Longer again! Thanks for your support in 2019, you helped us make our first project into ture, and it’s in mass production and become one of most popular affordable resin 3d printers in market. With thousands of reviewing and feedback from uers in community, the next generation 3d printer is bringing out.

The majority of LCD 3D printers in market are built in 5.5” 2K resolution of LCD screen, and the converntional pixel size of screen is 47.25um, is there any way to get a higher precision solution? If upgrade the 2K LCD screen to higher resolution for 4K, the pixel size will be driven down to 31.5um. Furthermore, if a pixel can be divided into 3 subpixels, the resolution in one direction will be as fine as 10.5um, which is a dramatic improvement over the 2K LCD screen.
With the algorithm embedded in Longerware, the UV exposure through each subpixel will be controlled accurately to deliver final 3D models with ultra-smooth surfaces and ultra-fine details.
Orange 4K is born!
Orange 4K is improved with one stand cover, built by metal body and dual liner guide, which is more stable and reliable. And it’s integrated with 2.8” touch screen, plastic resin vat with scale and simple levelling declined built plate.
The printed volume of Orange 4K is 118*66*190mm(4.64”*2.6”*7.48”). Orange 4K is equipped with 5.5” lcd screen, and there’re color & mono screen in configuration, reaching at 4K resolution 812 PPI. When configurated with color screen, one pixel in XY direction is 31.5um; while update with mono screen, one pixel of X direction is 31.5um, but Y direction has driven down to 10.5um. Moreover, The LCD screen has been improved on manufacturing procedure, and coated with galss cover over the screen, which will be better on protection. 
Orange 4K will be compatible with LongerWare, Chitubox & Lychee slicer, and we will setup the default printing parameter for color screen and monochrome screen. It will be much easier for user to select and configurate the printing parameter. 
Orange 4K Color 3d printer is able to upgrade to mono screen as well, but need to update the firmware. When Orange 4K is configurated with mono screen, the printing speed is up to 2s per layer, which will be increasing by 300% to reach at 60mm/h. 
PLAY

Thanks 3DArtGuy designed of Archagnel with Diorama, this character miniature printed by Orange 4K Color was got an amazing quality. 
PLAY

 Please reach our update #1 to figure out 4K Color & 4K Mono Printer difference. 
 Why Kickstarter? 
Longer has our own R&D team and has the design ability for hardware, firmware embedded, mechanical, and slicer development.  With months development and testing by our R&D team, the prototype of Orange 4K finally passed the test and printed with high qualified result. 

Launching on Kickstarter is building the bridge between initial users and Longer, and we hope we will get more feedback from customers and even make more improvement before this printer push into market. The voices from initial users are important to us.
 Longer 3D was established in 2014 but started with 3d printing material and industrial 3d printers. With years development on R&D, we have accumulated our own hardware designed ability, software and slicing algorithm on 3d printers and got 50 patents on 3d printing. We launched consumer 3d printers in 2018 and built with our own factory, then marketing with LONGER brand since 2019. Now we have established 10+ foreign warehouses, two fixing centers in US and three fixing service in Euro to provide better support service for customers. We keep the ultimate pursuit with our value: With Longer, Make it Better, to provide better quality and more affordable 3d printers for customers.

campaign.story:
Bluffy Pirates is an extremely fun, highly competitive, strategic party game, suited for groups from 4 to 6 people. The game is usually full of good (and bad ) emotions, as two main key aspects are timing and, as the name suggests, bluffing.
Move a tiny bit too early, and your treasure will be snatched right from your grip. A little too late? Well, better luck next turn.
The game never stops surprising you, as every player plays it a bit different. So many strategies, so many variables, and a single choice that will decide if you get to win the treasure, or see it hauled away to a foe's ship.
Each round, players fight each other for one of the many different magical treasures. During one's turn, the player has two choices: either play a card with a symbol of the treasure of the round, or skip the turn, waiting for better opportunities, or simply missing the necessary card to play. Players take turns clockwise, deciding on the best strategy to win the treasure. Once a player holds a treasure for an entire turn, he gets to take it back to his ship and gains its special effect. The game is over, once a player collects 4 different treasures.
The best part of the game is when you feel like a mastermind, like you've outsmarted all of your friends.  While everyone was fighting for the treasure, you were waiting for the perfect moment to strike. Just when one of your friends was about to take the treasure back to his ship, you laugh at his face and curb his expectations, by taking the treasure into your own hands. You feel ecstatic, you are about to win the game. And just at the moment when you think that you had it in the bag... campaign.story:
Important notice: The delivery of the printed deck will be delayed to January or even February 2021 due to unexpected high interest, winter holidays and a non responsive manufacturer. Read more about it in the update #5

Have you ever had the problem of needing to describe a dungeon and none of the players could really imagine how the structure is actually built? You don't always have to draw a battle map. Sometimes a small picture is enough to quickly show what the situation around the players looks like. Or did you ever try to come up with a dungeon room on the fly and just could not come up with an interesting layout? This deck of dungeon cards is perfect for those situations. 36 (now 54) unique cards full of stairs, dark corners, slim corridors, claustrophobic rooms, crates, barrels and much more to place monsters and treasure in.
Cards can be either used separately or combined to form larger dungeons. You can reveal one card after another as your players make their way through the dungeon and make them curious about each corner.
The cards are made out of professional 310gsm card stock with a blue core and smooth linen finish for the professional look & feel. The deck comes in a custom printed tuck box with a protective matte coating to give your cards the home they deserve. 
Speaking of... Each map (as well as the back of the card and the box) is completely hand-drawn. All 36 cards are already done and just need to be sent off to the printer.
So why Kickstarter? This is a test for me to see if such a deck is even wanted by enough people. If this project gets funded I can let the cards print for a reasonable price per deck without making a loss or charging an impossible high price.
Support Tiers
5€ - Get the PDF
You will get the full Deck of Dungeons (including the back side) as a PDF. This is perfect for those that would like to support this project but can't (or don't want to) afford the price of the physical deck + shipping costs.
15€ - Get the printed deck
You will get the physical Deck of Dungeons. Perfect for Dungeon Masters, as a present or just as a collectors item.
18€ - Physical & digital deck
Get both - The PDF and the printed deck. This is for people who play classically as well as digitally or want to collect the printed deck and use the digital one.
If you want more than one deck please contact me with the shipping country. I would need to calculate the additional costs depending on where to ship. Thank you for your understanding :)
Stretch Goals
I am very hesitant when it comes to stretch goals for this project. This is my first kickstarter and I just want everyone to get what they expect and as smoothly as possible. But if the project gets a lot more supporters than expected, I probably have no choice. So here is the goal:
[Unlocked] 300 Supporters - 54 Cards
If we hit 300 or more supporters I will increase the number of cards in this deck to 54. It doesn't matter if for the physical deck or the PDF version. If we reach 300 backers the deal is sealed. I will invest some extra time to come up with 18 additional cards.
So if you would like to have a thicker deck make sure to share this project and encourage your friends to grab a copy as well ;)
 Shipping
The Deck of Dungeon gets shipped worldwide. The shipping costs will be added after you selected your pledge level. 
Germany: 6 €
Rest of the EU, USA, Canada, Japan: 11 €
Rest of the world: 13 €

Of course it is always possible that something goes wrong during each step of the process and the shipping could get delayed. But I will try everything possible to avoid those problems and keep you updated on each and every step.

Hurray! 🎉 The first batch of shipments went out today. It's not the majority of packages but it's already a good start with countries all over the world.  Don't worry if you didn't get your tracking code today. The Fulfilment center needs a bit to pack and send out all ~1500 packages.
Okay, all fine and good. But when will you actually hold the Decks in your hands?
If you live in Germany you can expect the shipment to arrive within a couple of days after you received the tracking code. A few days more if you live within the EU. But for other countries (continents) it might take longer. Due to the ongoing pandemic packages get shipped via cargo ships instead of planes to the whole of America for example. I am not sure how it is with Asia or Australia but I expect the same.  I really chose the wrong year for this project 😅

Hello everyone!
I have good news. The Decks have been delivered to the Fulfilment center and are almost ready to ship. 😉
Unfortunately I need to clean up the exported addresses. The fulfilment center needs them in a very specific form which can not be provided by the Kickstarter export. For example street and house number need to be in separate fields, phone numbers shouldn't have special characters, names should be first & last name... Checking and fixing all this might take me another day or two. I will make sure to get it done as fast as possible.

Greetings!
I said I would close the surveys on the 20th. But my day job demanded a lot of extra attention the last days so I forgot to give another notice. But now for real. I will close the surveys in around 24 hours. So this is your last chance to fill it in if you didn't do it already and get the Decks as soon as possible. 😉
If you are not sure if you filled in your survey or not you can click on the "View survey" link at the top of the campaign page. It should look like this:

Is it already too late to wich you a happy new year? I don't think so. So - happy new year everyone! Let's hope this one isn't just a sequel of the dumpster fire 2020 has been for a lot of us.
On that note - let's begin this year with some good news. I got the confirmation from the printer that the decks should be ready by the 29th of January and get delivered to the fulfilment center on the week after (probably the 3rd of February). After the fulfilment company put the decks in stock the shipping can begin. For the backers living in the EU shipping should only take a few days. For other countries it might take longer. Especially since DHL decided to move smaller packages via ships and not planes around the globe. But I will get updates keep you updated on this of course. 😊

Hello everyone!
I know I did not post an update for a few weeks now. But that's simply because there is not much to tell you. The Decks are still in production. I also already signed the contract with the fulfilment company. So I am now in kind of a waiting mode. And I hate the feeling that I can't do anything to speed it up right now...
However... I mentioned that I might provide a voucher for everybody who wanted to gift the Deck of Dungeons on Christmas.  And after a couple of weeks of illness (yes, the virus-you-should-not-name) I finally came around to deliver on that. Here are two printable versions of the voucher. You own lots of dice . . . it's time to start playing with them!
Random Fun Generator, written by Sam Mitschke and Randy Scheunemann and illustrated by Len Peralta, includes over 20 new dice games, all of which can be played with standard six-sided dice.
Digital mockup, details not exact. Each game includes an illustration by Len Peralta! Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.


Random Fun Generator is a 76-page 7" x 10" B&W book that we're offering in both print and PDF. (Please note that print rewards are limited to U.S. backers only; we cannot ship any physical items to supporters outside the United States.) If you're on the hunt for more dice to add to your collection, we are making many of our custom dice sets available as add-ons (including some sets that have not yet been released) – see below.
Digital mockup, details not exact. More sample pages from Random Fun Generator! In addition to the rules, every game includes an example of play to make it easier to learn the games that are described in the book. Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.

Some of the games included in Random Fun Generator include:
 Great Rolled Ones – You and the other players are all cultists, attempting to summon Cthulhu and bring about the end of the world. 
 Leftovers – You and the other player are competing for points each round, but the player with the lowest total for the round gets to keep the leftovers as a bonus. Outwit your opponent and finish with the highest score!
 Participation Award – You and the other players must work together to defeat monsters, but you’re all a bit lazy and really don’t feel like working too hard.
 Liquid Courage - You and the other players are Dwarves. After centuries of peace, Dragons now threaten your way of life. Tunnel into long-forgotten mines to find the tools to help you survive the onslaught. With Dwarven beer to bolster your courage, only the bravest Dwarves will be celebrated as legendary heroes!
 Unreliable Flying Object - You and the other players are members of a spaceship crew, trying to return home. Your ship is pretty battered from the last mission, and things are constantly breaking, risking the lives of everyone aboard. Can you work together to keep the ship flying, or will you die in space?
 Six-Sided Slayers - In this cooperative game, you and the other players take on classic adventurer roles and charge deep into the monster’s lair. Kill enough monsters, and become legendary heroes! Fail too often, however, and you become a cautionary tale . . .
These plus another 20 games fill the pages of Random Fun Generator. Whether you play one as a filler between larger games or plan an entire evening of dice madness, Random Fun Generator has something for players of all ages!
Digital mockup, details not exact. Each game includes an illustration by Len Peralta! Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.

NOTE: Stretch goals only apply to the $35 and higher reward levels. The $6 PDF reward and the $15 and $31 print rewards do not benefit from unlocked stretch goals.  

Digital mockup, details not exact. Each game includes an illustration by Len Peralta! Sample pages are not 100% final and may change.

Dice
The following are dice sets only – not complete games. You may use any of these six-sided dice to play the games included in the Random Fun Generator book.

Dice Bags
Our large drawstring dice bags are satin-lined and each is ready to carry more than 100 dice of varying shapes and sizes. 

Dice Games
These are ready-to-play dice games, some of which include standard six-sided dice that may be used to play any of the games in the Random Fun Generator. Games that use custom dice – like Zombie Dice and Cthulhu Dice – cannot be used with the Random Fun Generator. 

Other Games
These games are perfect for your next game night!

After the Kickstarter project closes, and after all pledges are collected, we will open the BackerKit pledge manager. There, you will tell us your Warehouse 23 email address, provide your physical address, and pay for shipping (if you are receiving physical rewards). See the FAQ for estimated shipping costs.
Failure to complete your BackerKit survey by the deadline (which will be announced in a Kickstarter update once the pledge manager opens) will result in a refund and removal from the project. If you wish, you may choose to use a fulfillment service. This allows you to pledge for the project and then provide us with a U.S. address for delivery of your rewards. Forwarding from the fulfillment service, as well as any local fees, is your responsibility when using a fulfillment company.
INTERNATIONAL DELIVERY NOTE: No physical rewards are offered to international backers. updates.update_userinfo: Random Fun Generator 2 Update and Final Hours for the Illuminated Manuscript
updates.update_content:
As of yesterday, Sam and Randy have twenty different dice games for Random Fun Generator 2, the sequel to this project! We do not yet have a date for when Random Fun Generator 2 will launch on Kickstarter, but everything is moving in the right direction. In addition to the games, we also took a look at early concepts for the new artwork for the book; Sam roughs out ideas which we will send to Len Peralta when we're ready to move to the art and layout stage of the project.
While the team works on the new book, we would appreciate hearing from you about your favorite games in the original . So: Please comment on this update with the title of your favorite game in the book! If we find ourselves with more games than space, we'll use the info we collect here to influence which games, if any, are cut from the final manuscript.

updates.update_userinfo: You Like Dice? We Have Dice!
updates.update_content:
A couple of news items for today:
Work on Random Fun Generator 2 has officially started! Earlier this week, I sat in on a video meeting with Sam and Randy to discuss some of the new possible games and to play one of them. No solid schedule at the moment, but we're seeing some progress on the design and testing side.
We have launched a new pre-order store at BackerKit for dice, dice bags, and game accessories. This is also the place to order another print copy of the first Random Fun Generator book if you need extras to give out as gifts. There are several items listed: Check out the pre-order store today!

Thanks to the Warehouse 23 team (as well as our friends at PSI), we can report that the last of the print and dice rewards have shipped. Please watch for your print rewards to arrive just as soon as possible. If you spot an issue in your package, please contact help@sjgames.com for support.
For those of you who have asked where to find more dice, please see this page at Warehouse 23 for a list of our available dice, dice games, and accessories. The page changes as items sell-through and new releases are added, so the page may not look the same a month from now as it does today.

Two important bits of news today:
Physical rewards are still shipping! The Warehouse 23 team is packing and shipping rewards as fast as they can manage. We're a small team, and that combined with the social distancing rules we follow in the warehouse means that we can only ship so many packages each day. We will post an update when the last of the physical rewards have been shipped. (To accelerate the process, some of the rewards will be shipped from our primary fulfillment warehouse in Georgia.)
PDFs are being distributed through BackerKit, with Warehouse 23 distribution set to follow. The PDFs will take time to process, so please give us time to work through all of these files. Watch your email for the download link.

Earlier today, we started charging credit cards and locking BackerKit surveys. The books are in the final stages of printing and everything is on track for the Warehouse 23 team to start shipping the physical rewards later this month. 
As for the PDF reward, that is still on schedule to go out in December. 
A Sequel?

The time has come!
Random Fun Generator is off to print, and now we need to collect the necessary information to ship rewards for the future fulfillment process. Please check your email for a direct link to your Random Fun Generator survey (retrieval link)
BackerKit will guide you through the survey process. You may provide your Warehouse23 email address to save your PDF copy of Random Fun Generator. Than take a peek into the add-on store, and finally, provide any necessary shipping information for your order.

“Sleep Tight” has been tested with a big community of more than 500 testers worldwide. 
We received tons of feedback, we checked them all carefully, and polished all of the missing points.
Now the game is ready to be printed and shipped, all of the cards are done and all of the rules are written - the only thing we need is to hit the goal, print the game and bring it to your doorstep!
As soon as the campaign ends the printing and shipping process will start.
The only risk in our path is the delivery since delays could be applied due to external influences in some regions and countries. 
There will be other parties included like fulfillment agencies not controlled by us but offering a professional service.

DAMAGED PRODUCTS
As mentioned above, even when you give your maximum, external influences can get in the way. 
One such possibility is damage to products during the course of fulfillment. 
We will do our best to deliver the goods in perfect condition, and replacement of damaged games will be possible but please keep in mind that such replacements could be hard to do, depending on your location.
Please also keep in mind that minor cosmetic changes are not always damages.
In any case, The Moongrel will help you out!

NOT RESPONDING TO THE SURVEY (OR INCOMPLETE SURVEY)
This could result in a shipment delay for more than a few months. You will have enough time to complete the survey, so please make sure you do. Not completing the survey, or completing it after the final date we set could result in our inability to ship you the product, or applying the extra expenses. 

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By backing “Sleep Tight” you acknowledge that the final product is subject to changes in it’s contents, design and packing.
If you fail to deliver the survey and your shipping address during 4 weeks after the survey starts you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you for the payment and donation in full. 
Further, if the survey is failed to be completed in 4 weeks after the project ends, shipping the product may carry additional expenses.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Latest Updates:
[18/09] Enjoy free demo of the Bosch Puzzle @ tabletopia now. Here is the link: https://tabletopia.com/games/bosch-puzzle  Please check the latest update #12 here for more.
[17/09] Fine Art archival prints available now. Escherian stairwell with Bosch Characters available in the form of a museum grade fine art print. Please check the latest update #11 here. 
[10/09] Mini deck e-proofs, linen cotton canvas prints, and another AR card done - please check the latest update #9 here. 
[09/09] Numbered seal unlocked and going to be there on each deck. Please check the latest update#8 here. 
[05/09] Try the Bosch Jigsaw Puzzle online now. Completely free to play, it is a pretty good mental workout while also giving you the opportunity to appreciate the art. Links below for 50 pcs & 120 pcs challenge:
https://im-a-puzzle.com/bosch_puzzle_deck_demo_50_pcs_8XTQy1KV.puzzle    (50 pieces)
https://im-a-puzzle.com/bosch_puzzle_deck_demo_6ipKAPlE.puzzle  (120 pieces)
[03/09] Collector's Edition deck as Kickstarter exclusive first print run & initiation of the proofing process. Check update#6 here for more. 
[01/09] Augmented Reality/AR experience available now.  Bosch mini deck, Uncut sheet etc. available as an add-on. Please check the add-on table below or update #5 here. 

Add-ons
ABOUT THE PROJECT
The Bosch collector's edition deck is inspired by & based on the works of the first surrealist painter in the world, modern artist Hieronymus Bosch (or known as Jheronimus Bosch and El Bosco in Spain). 
The BOSCH deck is much more than a set of playing cards. It is a work of art divided into 54 unique and individual pieces that bring an entire universe to life. As in the master’s works, all the corners of these cards hide carefully illustrated details for an impressive composition. Those who back the project will also receive an exclusive 55th card paying tribute to M.C. Escher where Bosch characters go up and down his impossible staircase, thus combining the style of both masters.
Close to one and a half years in the making, this is the one deck that I am most proud of.  Whether you are a playing card collector or a  puzzle lover or an art collector, this 100% custom deck has got something for each one of you. These art playing cards are my passion, but they'll never become a reality without your support. Won't you join me while we explore the world of Hieronymus Bosch?
Bosch Puzzle Playing Cards- Collector's Edition
FEATURES:
A transformation* deck of Playing Cards - basically the "Iron Man" of custom playing card design
54 piece Polyptych magical Puzzle 
Each card is a self-contained picture, but laying the cards out in a specific sequence transforms the entire deck into a single large artwork masterpiece. 
A Kickstarter exclusive 55th card that is the world's first masterpiece combining M.C. Escher's work with Hieronymus Bosch - Only available to backers of this project & this special card won't be available in the leftover decks, so you won't like to miss it. 
Reaching the funding goal will ensure a print run of 1000 decks. 
Printed by Legends Playing Card Company on Classic Finish with Performance Coating
Elegant tuckbox with strategic embossing  done on the artwork & matte soft touch stock
 Numbered seal on every deck. Check the update#8 for more. Handnumbering the tucks is also being considered as an option. 
Poker sized (3.5" X 2.5") & traditional cut
 Augmented Reality (AR) experience available (on Apple & Android devices)
Get this Collector's Edition deck at a discounted rate when you pledge on Kickstarter
Shipping & Fulfillment by Gamblers Warehouse, Texas, USA who are the leaders in Kickstarter fulfillment
 *A transformation playing card (sometimes referred to as a transformation deck when assembled into a complete set) is a type of playing card where an artist incorporates the pips of the non-face cards into an artistic design. 



A pic from the Prototype deck
The unreality of living in a COVID-19 world, an unprecedented experience that contradicts the reality we have known, is like living in a Bosch painting ... Particularly relevant today, however, are the people encapsulated in bubbles, remindful that we now live lockdown indoors, and outdoors with faces masked.- David Lenefsky, law.com
Augmented Reality 
The cards offer an Augmented Reality (AR) feature that will transport you back to the 15th Century artwork of Hieronymus Bosch. App available on both Apple & Android devices. See the demo below to know more:

The Inspiration
All of Hieronymus Bosch's seminal works were closely studied and explored for hundreds of hours. Bosch Playing Cards is a 100% original work of art that combines a number of Bosch's works in an entirely original manner.  This makes it a unique and art masterpiece, which is now available to all Kickstarter backers.
The Garden of Earthly Delights
The Temptation of St. Anthony
The Last Judgment
Ship of Fools

Puzzle & the Art
The polyptych puzzle playing cards is an ode to the legacy of Hieronymus Bosch.  Each card is an individual piece of art while placing the 54 cards together transforms these individual parts into a single larger masterpiece. 
The cards combine the essence of a transformation deck, in which the suits interact in the scene as elements integrated into it, with the nature of a puzzle deck, in which the dynamism of the characters is accentuated by their connection with those depicted in the other cards they are connected to. The Bosch deck is not only a deck of fine art playing cards, but it is a magical puzzle too. When placed together in the right sequence, the entire deck of 54 cards transforms itself into a single bigger masterpiece. A perfect gift for family gatherings & parties, I've even used it as a challenge to solve while in isolation during these COVID days. 
Are you ready to solve it in record time?  Check the online demo of the puzzle @ tabletopia here:  https://tabletopia.com/games/bosch-puzzle
Polyptych Puzzle incorporates 54 cards in a specific sequence to form a bigger masterpiece
Let pictures do the talking now.

The 55th card is a Kickstarter exclusive, available only to backers of this project.  The illustration on this card is inspired by one of the most renowned works by MC Escher, the Escherian Stairwell, but adds Hieronymus Bosch's special touch to it, thus making it an ode to both masters. Just as Escher reproduced one of Bosch's works in 1935, so the completely original artwork on this extra 55th card is an attempt to reproduce one of Escher's prolific works, through the lens of Bosch. Only available as the 55th card to the backers of this Kickstarter project. 
Kickstarter exclusive 55th Card - A tribute to M.C. Escher and Hieronymus Bosch
Kickstarter exclusive 55th card (enlarged) - Inspired by M.C. Escher and Hieronymus Bosch
Card back

 I spent hundreds of hours studying Bosch's paintings, and this helped me observe many small details in his work.  The following snapshots showcase some of those hidden details, which you will find reproduced in a completely original manner in this unique deck of cards.
Small details in Garden of Earthly Delights

Collector's Uncut Sheet
The Collector's Uncut Sheet is a great piece of art and a wonderful conversation starter. These authentic limited editions uncut sheets of playing cards will be pulled straight off the factory press. They will arrive ready to be framed on your wall and will be safely shipped in a sturdy round tube. To add uncut sheets to your pledge, increase your pledge by USD $44 (shipping included).
When initial renderings of the Bosch deck were shared, a backer of one of my previous Kickstarter projects posted comments along these lines: "This is the one painter that I would LOVE to own an original painting from!! Alas, so few known examples of his work exist, that I would have to have the money of a Russian oligarch IF one would ever come up for sale!  So instead I will have to settle for this great looking deck of cards!"
The uncut sheet will have 54 cards (and not the Kickstarter exclusive 55th card) due to the special print layout required for the uncut sheet. 
Mockup of the uncut sheet
To add uncut sheets to your pledge, increase your pledge by USD $44 (shipping included).
Fine Art Archival Prints
Introducing the museum grade archival prints....A conversation starter....
Using Archival pigment ink system & museum grade paper (315 GSM acid free paper)
After experimenting with glossy poster paper, linen canvas, poly-cotton canvas, and archival quality paper, I'm going with the archival quality museum-grade paper to produce one of the finest art prints available on Kickstarter. The minimum print run required at the printer is 10, and I will be taking the total number pledged on Kickstarter (and during the survey process) to keep the number limited. 
Please message me once you've added either or both the art prints. First come first serve. Note that international shipping is high for shipping a large poster. The Bosch Collector's Edition deck will be printed by Legends Playing Card Co. (LPCC), and printed in Taiwan with their Classic Finish.  This is a softer and slicker paper, comparable in feel and handling to a Bicycle deck, but with a more durable card-stock.  USPCC is unable to print this deck with the given requirements, and LPCC is one of the few printers who can print this deck of the cards with the given layout for the uncut sheet layout, along with the full bleed artwork.

SHIPPING
Everything ships from the USA & I will be using the services of Gamblers Warehouse in Texas.  Shipping is automatically applied when you choose any reward tier and specify your country. You do not need to add anything extra. Avail discounted shipping prices when you pledge for any reward.  
USA backers - Free Shipping when you choose reward tiers of 6+ decks
International backers - Only $10 USD when you choose a reward tier of 1-5 decks
This is cheaper than the actual postage fees, so I'll pay the rest out of my own pocket to help you get Bosch in your hands. 
Given GW's expertise in fulfillment & shipping, I expect the fulfillment experience to be smooth similar to my past projects. The decks will be shipped from Legends factory in Taiwan to the USA and I am also absorbing some of those costs to get you an awesome deal when you back this deck on Kickstarter. That said, COVID has caused some disruption of shipping lines and I will be informing backers throughout the course of the project if any delay in shipping & fulfillment arises. 

 WHY PURCHASE ON KICKSTARTER? 
Funding is really critical for all independent creators like me. Join me to help push the playing card world forward. Transformation and such art decks are a rarity these days. 
The Collector's Edition has the Kickstarter exclusive 55th card that will be only available to the backers of this project and won't be there in the leftover decks. Once they're gone, they're gone! 
The addition of a free micro deck is also unprecedented and available to the backers for free and only for the first 48 hours of this campaign. 
 Unique discount, only for KS. Save money now by supporting the project. My previously produced decks are usually sold on Ebay at 5x-7x the price on Kickstarter. As an example, each card of A Motley Pack Transformation deck is sold for $24 each per card on Ebay. A few limited edition decks are not available anywhere. 
All discounted Kickstarter prices will be increased in retail stores once the project is over, which means Kickstarter is the only place you can get them first and at this price. The leftover decks will only have 54 cards, so you won't get the Kickstarter Exclusive card from the world of Escher & Bosch elsewhere except on eBay where you might find this deck at a highly inflated price. 
Help us spread the word via the “Share this project” button above. Share this with your friends and family now.

WHY KICKSTARTER

With the funding goal achieved, I will be able to take the idea to production and get this beautifully crafted deck across to all of you out there. Let's make this project become a reality, and turn this into a published deck! Thank you!
ABOUT GPCC
The vision we have at GPCC is to pay tribute to the great artistic works of the past.  
My name is Sunish Chabba, and along with my friend & illustrator Ishan Trivedi, I am proud to introduce you to  "Bosch Playing Cards- Collector's Edition".
Guru Playing Card Company (aka GPCC) has already produced 7 successful kickstarter projects to date.  We have the unique accomplishment of having delivered premium quality products to backers across 25 countries, with the shortest lead time, all the while maintaining great communication with our backers at every phase of the Kickstarter campaign from to production to fulfillment.  I stand behind the production and delivery of the products shown above, and I am sure you will be delighted with the outcome. 
You can read more about GPCC here: Brand Spotlight: Guru Playing Card Company 
 In my life outside of GPCC, I work on digital projects.  But it means so much to have a tangible and crafted item in your hands to marvel at, and my goal in GPCC is to create exactly this kind of unique item for you.

To Reetika without whose encouragement, this won't have been possible. To my previous Kickstarter backers who used to message me since 2019 on when will this be completed. 
Special thanks to Montenzi for his quick response to my questions. He is always willing and open to share both information & knowledge, a real asset to the design world. Thanks to Ben Jones from Elephant Playing Cards, because the Bosch deck started as an entirely different concept, but in the end became a polyptych puzzle. Ben had produced his Pipmen World deck a few years back, and as the Bosch deck is another polyptych puzzle-based deck of playing cards, a special thanks is due to him, since I took some inspiration from Ben's Pipmen World project for the mockups.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've successfully produced & fulfilled 7 projects on Kickstarter. All of these were delivered to backers way earlier than the estimated date & I am proud to say that my projects on Kickstarter have got one of the shortest lead times in this as well as the whole Games category as such on Kickstarter. This coupled with frequent communication through updates ensure that you as backers are on the journey towards making the project a reality. I'm confident that this project will be able to meet and/or exceed the expectations from backers similar to my past projects.

If there are any speed bumps during production, I will do my very best to communicate with you about what is going on and how I plan to resolve any issues. Risk mitigation while maintaining constant communication with the backers will be my strategy for this project as well. COVID-19 is the biggest risk for the printing, shipping and delivery section of this process, and therefore I have put a much later delivery date than I actually anticipate. Though I will likely be ready to start printing as soon as the Kickstarter ends, there is a likely chance of delays due to the nature of the beast there— in printing, but most especially in shipping.


The finished product may vary slightly from the art shown here. As it goes through the printing process, minor revisions may need to be made, and I will keep backers informed of such cases.

You, as a backer, are responsible for import duties, VAT or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities in your respective country as well as providing correct address information in the survey after the campaign has ended.

Thanks for visiting the project page. Please feel free to reach out to me for any questions.

-Sunish

campaign.story:
The Next Cotta's Almanac Transformation Playing Cards
***
Introducing a precisely digitally hand-recreated reproduction of the next Cotta's almanac deck full of history continuing a year after the previous blue one, which was the first published complete transformation playing card deck in the world! 
The green "Andromaque" deck is the second in a series of six famous decks we plan to release in 2020...
The second transformation deck issued by Cotta is from 1806, following the remarkable success of the first almanac deck. This deck was also aimed to have well-known court cards, the interesting main character, and featured figures from classical antiquity, taken from sources such as Greek and Roman plays, as well as the Bible, which adds another historical value to its rarity.  
Original illustrations were fiddling artworks - manually stipple engraved & etched on copper plates
"Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck)
There are many historical values in the series of decks! But if you are only interested in the deck details & images instead of history & backstory with additional description on the theme individually to each deck, then please skip about halfway down.
Charming beginning of "Karten Almanach" series
The story behind these playing cards, which probably conceal most of the world's playing card secrets, begins in Tübingen, a city in southwest Germany. 
The idea behind the concept of Cotta's transformation decks was to create a series of six decks on an annual basis from 1805-1811. Each deck would focus on a different theme, with the second set based on Racine's plays such as Andromache (1667), Britannicus (1669), Iphigénie (1674), and Esther (1689), which featured figures from the history of classical antiquity, Greek and Roman mythology, Bible, ...
Forming a "Card Almanac" (Karten Almanach), each card in the deck would represent one of the 52 weeks in a calendar year. At the time it was popular to print various almanacs, which were special pocketbooks for the new year, and often included a short poem or quote for each week of the calendar year. It was a logical move to connect each of these 52 weeks with playing cards.
 The famous Cotta's publishing house... 
Johann Friedrich Cotta
The friendship that gave birth to the idea of Cotta's transformation playing card almanac decks... 
Unexplained stories, hidden mysteries, secrets...
"Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck)
It is especially significant for the way it displays meaningful and inspirational happenings from the time; in this second deck, the theme may reflect something of the religious climate of the day, also with assumed depictions from the life of noble families, etc...
Jean-Baptiste Racine (*December 22, 1639 - April 21, 1699)
Second almanac deck: "Andromache" (Year 1806) 
The images on the court cards are the "Greek and Roman mythology" characters mostly centered around the Trojan war and inspired by Jean Racine's plays such as Iphigénie, Esther, Britannicus and the "Andromaque" ("Andromache") which was first time performed on 17 November 1667 before the court of Louis XIV in the Louvre in the private chambers of the Queen, Marie Thérèse, by the royal company of actors, called "Les Grands Comédiens", with Thérèse Du Parc in the title role. Andromaque, as the third of Racine's plays, written at the age of 27, established its author's reputation as one of the great playwrights in France. 
*(We technically named this almanac deck the "Andromache" in its title for the main character "Andromaque" depicted as Queen of Spades, same as Joan of Arc was placed there on the Queen of Spades card in previous blue Cotta's deck themed on Joan.)
Around the time of Cotta's playing cards being produced, lots of creative people have found inspiration in Racine's playwrights. The composer André Grétry wrote a three-act opera, Andromaque, with a libretto based on the Racine play, which premiered in 1780. In addition, Rossini's two-act 1819 opera, Ermione, is based on Racine's play too.
"Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck)
The central figure of Andromaque is depicted as the Queen of Spades, she is the wife of the Trojan military hero Hector, daughter of Eetion, and sister to Podes and six other brothers; her name Andromache represents "courage" and has a meaning of "man fighter". (And so she might be the most interesting "main" character of the second Cotta's almanac deck.)
Andromache was taken from her father's household by Hector and they together fit the Greek ideal of a happy and productive marriage, which heightens the tragedy of their shared misfortune. Andromache portrayed the role of perfect wife and mother who, a full year after the destruction of Troy, fulfills the fate of conquered Trojan women in ancient warfare as a widow held in captivity with her young son by Pyrrhus in Epirus, and later a distressed mother who despairs at the murder of her son Astyanax... 
Features:
Printed by USPCC on Classic Stock
Poker Size
Embossed Finish
52 Cards + 2 Extra Jokers + 2 Extra Collectible Cards
Metallic Ink On Box & Backs
Custom Seals - Numbered and Standard 
Puzzle Image on all Tuck Spines of the Series
Digitally Hand-Recreated and Designed by Azured Ox
Produced By Will Roya
Cotta's second deck was, as well as the first deck, designed by Countess Mary Day von Jennison-Walworth (sometimes spelled with a single 'n'). Her maiden name was Beauclerk, and she was the wife of Count Francis Jenison Walworth (1764–1824). She was an illegitimate (twin) child who led a very colorful life and finally settled down somewhat after marrying Count Francis in 1797. (Probably, she was creating illustrations in Stuttgart.)
2 Limited Editions
After the success of the first blue Cotta's almanac deck, to meet your demand, now we come with two versions of second green Cotta's deck limited edition - the "Numbered" and the "Standard". As a campaign before, we are limiting this 2nd "Numbered" deck to only 1,000 copies of tuck which is the whole gold-inked with custom numbered seals. Additional "Standard" limited edition decks are created just with a slight difference on tuck designed with dark and gold ink combination and the same custom seals (non-numbered).
The design of both versions of Cotta's limited edition tuck boxes, the standard and the numbered, created by Azured Ox, have been inspired by the old books and published writers work using the gold ink on their covers as well as combined with the dark ink.
With the Elements of Heraldic Achievement...
Includes heraldry symbols connected with the family and past of the noble designer countess Jenison von Walworth who created the most of the Cotta's decks...
The entire 6 deck series is in many ways designed by Azured Ox to meet collector's demand (as "collection of historical books") and will be produced with the piece of puzzle image on each tuck spine (left side of the box) to create together a nice display of the Tuebingen monument surroundings, where the idea for Cotta's decks was born.
Spine Puzzle Image of "Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck) *Puzzle Image of "Standard" Limited Edition is Dark-Inked
 *(These are just "Digital Demonstrations" to present ink combinations of both editions)
*Puzzle Image of "Standard" Limited Edition Displayed (Combined Metallic Gold + Dark Inked Tuck)
"Numbered" Limited Edition Displayed (Whole Metallic Gold-Inked Tuck)
Six Unique Different Card Back Patterns Designed, with Regard to Card Handling, Individually for Each of the Cotta's Deck Year Almanacs.
Classic Style Borderless Full-Bleed Card Back Design with Luxury Feeling and Metallic Ink
The Same Gold Metallic Ink Card Back Design for Both Editions of the Cotta's Deck
The publisher's name was placed on the Ace of Clubs as follows: "A Tubinge chez J. G. Cotta, Libraire."
The transformations on the number cards have no reference to each other or to the court cards (as well lots of them might be considered as an unexplained mystery).
Classical, Historical, Mythological, Biblical...
The court cards were designated with the words "Valet", "Dame", and "Roi", which are the French terms corresponding to the Jack, Queen, and King.
There is evidence of Tübingen having a Jewish community in its past (e.g. the Middle Ages), but since catholic reforms were being enacted when this deck was being produced, this also may have been a motive for choosing illustrations that depicted classical and historical heroes and heroines mostly from Greek mythology, as well as the major roles from tragedies by French playwriter and dramatist Jean Racine, such as Andromaque, Iphigénie, Esther, and Britannicus.
Ahasuerus (King of Spades) is the Biblical name for Xerxes, the King of Persia who died in 465 BC. Other Biblical characters include Esther (Queen of Clubs), Xerxes' wife and Jewish heroine who rescued her nation from the evil Haman; and her uncle Mordecai (Jack of Hearts). Agrippina the Younger (Queen of Diamonds) was Nero's mother, while Sextus Afranius Burrus (Jack of Spades) was a Praetorian prefect, whom Agrippina helped to his position under Claudius and Nero.
Mythical characters include Andromache (Queen of Spades), the wife of Hector of Troy, described in the famous Iliad; Ulysses (King of Hearts), the Greek leader and hero from the Odyssey; Agamemnon (King of Diamonds), leader of the Greeks in the Trojan War; Iphigenia (Queen of Hearts), Agamemnon and Clytemnestra's daughter; Orestes (Jack of Diamonds), their son who kills his mother and her lover for murdering his father; Pyrrhus (King of Clubs), son of Achilles, who is put to death by Orestes; and Arcas (Jack of Clubs), son of Jupiter and Kalisto, who was a servant to Agamemnon.
Burrhus, tutor of Nero the Emperor, Agrippina was Nero's mother and she helped Burrhus on his position; 
Andromache, the wife of the Trojan military hero Hector, daughter of Eetion, and sister to Podes and six other brothers, she was held in captivity by Pyrrhus; 
Ahasuerus, King of Persia
 Mordecai, Uncle to Esther
In Greek mythology, Iphigenia was a daughter of King Agamemnon and Queen Clytemnestra, (and so sister of Orestes), and thus a princess of Mycenae.
Odysseus, Greek hero also known by the Latin variant Ulysses
Arcas, servant to Agamemnon
Esther (Queen of Persia) is described in all versions of the biblical Book of Esther as the Jewish queen of a Persian king Ahasuerus. In the narrative, Ahasuerus seeks a new wife after his queen, Vashti refuses to obey him, and Esther is chosen for her beauty. 
Neoptolemus, also called Pyrrhus, was the son of the warrior Achilles and the princess Deidamia in Greek mythology, and also the mythical progenitor of the ruling dynasty of the Molossians of ancient Epirus.
Orestes was the son of Clytemnestra and Agamemnon, (and so the brother of Iphigenia). He is the subject of several Ancient Greek plays and of various myths connected with his madness and purification, which retain obscure threads of much older ones. 
Agrippina, widow of Domitius Enobarbus father of Nero, & from the second marriage, widow of Emperor Claudius
In Greek mythology, Agamemnon was a king of Mycenae, the son, or grandson, of King Atreus and Queen Aerope of Mycenae, the brother of Menelaus, the husband of Clytemnestra and the father of Iphigenia, Electra or Laodike, Orestes and Chrysothemis. Legends make him the king of Mycenae or Argos, thought to be different names for the same area. When Menelaus's wife, Helen, was taken to Troy by Paris, Agamemnon commanded the united Greek armed forces in the ensuing Trojan War.
At last, we came with an idea to reflect the opposite of noble life and to bring closer to you even more of the unique artistic history placed on extra collectible playing cards...
Also, we thought it could be interesting to put other illustrations from the far past on the additional extra cards, in respect to year almanacs, we came with an idea of twelve calendar months in the series as an exclusive collection of unique historical artworks...
 An absolutely original playing card masterpiece to hang on your wall (double-sided)
With help from you the backers we plan to produce the entire 6 deck series! The color of each tuck box created by Azured Ox has been inspired by Goethe's experimental optic and color theory, since Goethe was an important contemporary of Cotta, along with Schiller. (Goethe's deepest immersion into colors was during Cotta's decks issuing.)
"Numbered" Limited Edition
"Standard" Limited Edition (Non-Numbered)
Add-Ons will be based on availability and will be announced after the campaign.  USPCC under printed Cotta #1 limited edition and we want to make sure we do not over sell the decks.

ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE is my third Kickstarter, this project consists of a set of zombie-themed characters and terrains.
For only € 18 (65 for commercial license), you would have:
PACK ALL IN + STREACH GOALS + SPECIAL STREACH GOALS
All of this means 45 miniatures (including terrain pieces) and a diorama.
 The city is infested with zombies and monsters, work to survive this pitched battle. Unfortunately, the number of zombies is much greater than the number of survivors.
You will receive the digital files. These models are ideal for resin printers, but also suitable for FDM printers.
These characters can be used in wargame games or to make your own made-up campaigns.

campaign.story:
Welcome Travellers!
The Dwarves was a successful Kickstarter by Epics 'N' Stuffs. The original campaign can be viewed here - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/epicsnstuffs/the-dwarves
Epics 'N' Stuffs is a DnD driven miniature patreon which creates a range of sculpts from varying parts of the lore with their own unique style.
We've had many requests for late pledges and merchant tiers, the original campaign also went beyond the final deliverables of 49 Models (including the base Dwarves and Stretch goals). This campaign will deliver those original assets committed plus additional variants/models as well as a Merchant tier facility. That's a lot of fully supported Dwarf models in 2 size variants.  ***This is a digital only Campaign***
The Assets in this bundle won't be offered again at this insane price so get it whilst you can!!!
 A BIG THANKS!!!
We'd also like to thank everyone in advance of their support, especially those who backed our original Dwarf campaign and our patrons over @ Epics 'N' Stuffs Patreon. Thanks to your support, and that of Kickstarter we've been able to offer the Dwarves from the original campaign PLUS MORE! to new people within the community. Thanks again, it means a lot.
Any Questions?
If you have any questions please refer to the FAQs at the bottom of the campaign page or alternatively DM us directly or email us over at epicsnstuffs@gmail.com
A couple of FREE .STL file's are available here to test print for yourself, it also includes a Chitubox file if you happen to be printing on a resin unit. 
 Toilet Paper Merchant - https://ln2.sync.com/dl/ab7ff7910/vy34g96p-fb7i98jv-93ahy2dk-hvpyp9z3
 Dwarven Rogue Variant 6 - https://ln2.sync.com/dl/73ebbe1b0/i3qirygq-5nvjfih7-ghj47jne-vmuj5sb2
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Here are the renders for each Dwarf and some images of print results .
Backers will receive the chitubox project files which contain the models hollowed and supported, the same files I used to print the models below. So if you have a resin machine such as the Elegoo Mars, Epax X1, Anycubic Photon etc... these files will just need slicing and should be ready to go :)
 Prints shown were made using an Elegoo Mars or Elegoo Mars Pro.

Additional variants for this campaign!
PATREON X KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!
If you're a patreon backer over @ Epics 'N' Stuffs Patreon and happen to back either of the Dwarves Kickstarter campaigns you'll also get an additional model, the Dwarven Bannerman. All you need to do is either DM us or email us over at epicsnstuffs@gmail.com with your Kickstarter name and patron name/email. Once the campaign is over and everything has been processed/uploaded we'll send send you a direct link to the specific model. 
Upon a successful campaign/funding, Kickstarter takes 2 to 3 weeks to process pledges. Once that is done we will send everyone a direct message via kickstarter containing links/passwords to the library of assets for the campaign.
FAQs
Q, Why're you not offering physical tiers this time around?
A. There are a few factors, time investment being the main one, printing, prepping, boxing, sending all the models personally was a large 'time-sink'. Also with Covid it introduced consumable shortages and delivery delays which both financially kicked us as well as ate further into the time we could have been using to make the models. It's not to say we won't do another campaign in future with physical assets, just not this time around.
Q. Are the .STL's game size?
A. They're provided on 25mm and 32mm bases (some on 40mm and 50mm like the King). These sizes are typically bigger then your normal tabletop, they're a good size to paint and play. You can always scale them in your slicer to your desired size. I typically use this .STL to help with that - https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3649454
Q. Can you not use 'insert service name here' instead of Sync?
A. Sync, despite it's flaws, proves to be the most reliable in our experience. We have used Dropbox in the past and ran into a plethora of issues including long outages, and hard daily limits. Sync has no daily download limit and the files will be hosted for an extremely long time. We have delivered these files to over 1000 people with great results. Any issues please ask and we'll aim to help :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
None really,
The assets are all digital in this campaign and have already been delivered to a large number of people. Be sure you can utilize Sync (Try downloading and printing the test/free files). There are a lot of files to accommodate different sizes and requirements, so aiming to download everything in a large chunk is not advised.
We do however provide individual files for download as well as a huge .rar containing everything.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Generic Universal RolePlaying System!
With GURPS, you can be anyone you want – an elf hero fighting for the forces of good, a shadowy femme fatale on a deep-cover mission, a futuristic swashbuckler carving up foes with a force sword in his hand and a beautiful woman by his side . . . or literally anything else! Thanks to its flexibility, quality writing, and ease of use, GURPS has been the premiere universal roleplaying game for over three decades! 
More than 1,500,000 copies are in print – not counting foreign editions. GURPS Lite, a 32-page distillation of the basic GURPS rules, is available for free download. We also have dozens of GURPS adventures and e-books available on Warehouse 23.
Whatever your favorite roleplaying genre might be, GURPS can handle it. More about GURPS . . . 
The GURPS team, under the direction of GURPS Line Editor Sean Punch, has prepared a dozen different PDFs . . . and this is your chance to possibly grab all twelve of the new PDFs for only $3!
Starting with the latest expansion to the GURPS Action series (see Warehouse 23), your pledge of $3 secures you a PDF copy of GURPS Action 6 - Tricked Out Rides. This 10-page PDF, written by Sean Punch, is a quick-and-dirty toolkit for adventures where sports cars pack more gadgetry than fighter jets, and miniguns fit behind headlights!

One new PDF is great, but the project gets more exciting for all of the backers as stretch goals are unlocked. With each unlocked stretch goal (see below), we'll add another one of the twelve new PDFs to your rewards . . . that $3 pledge becomes an even better deal as more backers join the campaign.
Please share this campaign with all of your friends!
Are you looking for an even better deal? Check out the $99 reward! In addition to the new PDF and all unlocked stretch goals, you will also receive $125 in credit to spend in BackerKit on GURPS PDFs of your choice. See the add-ons section, below, for more information.
NOTE: Only PDFs published by Steve Jackson Games and currently listed for sale on Warehouse 23 will be available to project supporters. We cannot list PDFs by other publishers or PDFs that we do not currently sell.
Do you want even more PDFs? During the BackerKit survey (see below), we will offer these -- and many more! -- PDFs as add-on items. You may increase your pledge by the listed amounts and then, in BackerKit, make your exact PDF choices. All PDFs will be delivered through both BackerKit and Warehouse 23, our online store.
While we will not immediately offer every GURPS PDF that is available at Warehouse 23 in the BackerKit survey, we will do our best to meet your requests. If, once the surveys open, you do not see your preferred selections, please email help@sjgames.com for support and the team will add your choices to the survey.
NOTE: Only PDFs published by Steve Jackson Games and currently listed for sale on Warehouse 23 will be available to project supporters. We cannot list PDFs by other publishers or PDFs that we do not currently sell.
For those of you who cannot wait for this campaign to be complete to get your hands on more PDFs, you can find the entire catalog of GURPS PDFs at both Warehouse 23 and DrivethruRPG. Remember, though, that choosing add-ons during this Kickstarter campaign helps push us closer and closer to unlocking the stretch goals. The more funds we can raise during the project, the better our chances of unlocking all twelve PDFs!
Can we unlock all twelve PDFs before the clock runs out?
PDFs will be delivered through both BackerKit (see below) and our online store, Warehouse 23. We encourage you to create a Warehouse 23 account if you do not already have one so that your PDFs can be added to your Warehouse 23 library.
Learn more about Warehouse 23 here!
This project offers only PDFs. There will be no print rewards, and no print add-ons, so that we can concentrate on delivering the PDFs as fast as possible. This means no printed books, no dice, and nothing that would require shipping physical items. PDFs only!
BackerKit Surveys
We will be using BackerKit to collect email addresses and manage any add-on choices that you may make, and failure to complete your survey will mean that you will not be able to download your rewards. We will post an update when the BackerKit surveys have opened and, at that time, we will post the survey deadline date.
Once the Kickstarter campaign is over and all rewards have been delivered, the PDFs unlocked during this project will be released on Warehouse 23. At that time, each will be priced as individual titles; the special price of all unlocked PDFs for only $3 will only be available in this campaign.

For those of you who have been asking about a second GURPS PDF Challenge, we're ready to announce that Steve Jackson Games' GURPS Pyramid Scheme is almost ready for Kickstarter launch. While not an exact copy of the approach used for the PDF Challenge that all of you supported earlier this year, the GURPS Pyramid Scheme campaign means more GURPS support for fantasy, modern, and sci-fi games.

Thank you, everyone, for your support of this campaign! As of earlier today, the last of the Warehouse 23 files have been distributed, shifting this project officially into the complete column. We could not have done this without all of you!
What's next for GURPS? Sean and the team are working on several new releases, and we have plans to take what we have learned from this PDF challenge and try something new in the future. Please follow the Warehouse 23 Kickstarter account for email notification when we launch a new project.

The Warehouse 23 fulfillment process has started! This will be done in stages and as quick as we can manage, but it will definitely take some time to get everyone's PDFs added to their Warehouse 23 accounts. Please hold off on contacting the team with project questions; we will post another update here once Warehouse 23 fulfillment is complete. 
How long will this take? Unknown. Darryll started the process earlier today and it is going to take weeks, possibly several weeks, to wrap up this stage of the project. We're still on track to complete the campaign by the estimated delivery date, and possibly sooner than that.

Thank you to everyone who has wrapped up your surveys! 
For those of you who have not yet completed your surveys, please remember that these must be finished by the end of August. At the end of the month, we will issue refunds for any incomplete surveys and you will be removed from this project. 
PDF Rewards

After a fairly smooth smoke test, we decided to open the doors so we can start the survey and delivery process. 
When will I get my PDFs?
PDF Purchases will be distributed periodically via Backerkit. After you complete your survey, it may take up to 7 days for you to receive download links in BackerKit.

Hey folks!
Moments ago I flipped the necessary switch to begin the Smoke Test for the GURPS 2020 PDF Challenge! Approximately 150 of you will be randomly selected across the various pledge levels to complete your surveys and collect your PDFs. We need your help to make sure that the whole BackerKit can roll out soon! 
As this is our first all-digital BackerKit, I expect to have some speed bumps that might need to be smoothed over. A lot of behind the scenes work was done to load in physical variants where possible for many of the GURPS items. If you see a physical item available, drop me a line directly via e-mail to (Darryll@SJGames.com). This goes for any oddities you might come across.

We've crossed the finish line with more than $57,000 in pledges. You didn't just unlock all 12 PDFs (remember when $45,000 seemed far off?) - you kept on going. Thank you for your support! 

More impressive is that when I say "you," I'm talking about more than 2,700 backers. That's . . . staggering. It's a big vote of confidence for short PDFs (at least some of the time!), future Kickstarters like this one, and GURPS. 

Again: Thank you. And thanks to Phil Reed for orchestrating everything, Steve Jackson for encouraging us to run with it, our writers, Steven Marsh for matching those writers with topics and art, and Nikki Vrtis for laying out a dozen PDFs in no time flat. It was a team effort in every sense!

- Sean "Dr. Kromm" Punch

campaign.story:
Black It Out is a fun roll and write game that is extremely simple yet offers great tactical decisions.
Playing in roughly 15 minutes (with no set up time) Black It Out is ideal for families, as a warm up at the start of a games night or as a 'one last game' before the night is over. 
The aim of the game is to be the person who has 'blacked out' the most of their grid.
On a turn you will roll three dice, total two of them which will give you a shape and then draw that shape on to your grid to 'black it out'!
The grid you will try to black out and some examples of the shapes
You will repeat this over 20 rounds and see who can 'black out' the most of their grid.
The round tracker
It's quick, simple and can be played by almost everyone. It has been especially designed so that players can play remotely and with their whole families.
Fun for all the family
To play you will need to provide 3 of your own 6 sided dice (these will not come as part of the kickstarter).
Works well playing remotely with friends
The base pledge will come with two different player sheets. This means that different numbers on the dice will be valuable to different players and adds an element of variety and replayability.
The advance pledge comes with an additional two player sheets - giving you four sheets in total. These sheets add an optional rule that adds more player interaction while ramping up the variety. It can still be played remotely but works even better in person! You will need access to more dice to play the optional rules (the exact total depends on the number of players). The new sheets will add different shapes and can still be played in combination with the base game sheets.
Once the game has been funded and I have received the money from Kickstarter I will distribute the game as PDFs. 
£500 Stretch Goal: unlocked! 
Due to the awesome support so far, I have decided to add a stretch goal. If we can make it to £500 pledged I will add an extra player sheet for every backer!
That will mean that everyone will be getting either 3 or 5 sheets depending on the your backer level!
More sheets = more variety = more fun!
£600 stretch goal: 
 Well we smashed the £500 goal so it‘s time to unlock another player sheet but this time just for the backers at the £2 or higher pledge level (the ‘base and advanced level’). This will means that if you’ve backed at that level you will be getting 6 sheets! 
£750 stretch goal:
A reformatting of the player sheets to allow more sheets on each page you print! This will result in easier storage and portability whilst maintaining the ease of play. 
Thanks for backing Black It Out!

campaign.story:
In Sleep Tight you are kids stuck in a very special dream...a dream where the Sandman lives. Your souls have been shattered, and the only way to wake up is to collect Soul Fragments by traversing your nightmares. But watch out, because the Sandman will haunt you trying to consume your remaining Soul Fragments.
Team up against the Sandman or turn against each other. If the Sandman is killed, everyone wins. But if one of you wakes up first, they win, while the other players stay trapped in the nightmare forever, left as a feast for the Sandman.
Try this game of cooperation, conflict, betrayal, and nightmares 
WHAT IS SPECIAL ABOUT SLEEP TIGHT
Sleep Tight is a game with a unique atmosphere and fast and dynamic gameplay. We played a lot of board games, card games and tons of RPGs and wanted to create an easy to learn game that relies on a universal language (uses just symbols and icons for all actions - which are easy to learn). The game is also full of tactics and options and demands a mastering of the possibilities and choices as it can be a game of cooperation, individual play, or backstabbing while you play as the Sandman’s undercover ally.
Easy to learn and easy to dive in mechanics even for inexperienced players
  Card use easy to learn and accessible symbols
  A dynamic, fast, and intense system
  The game is for 2-4 players
HOW TO PLAY SLEEP TIGHT
Sleep Tight is a 10-20 minute game that is dynamic and fast-paced in terms of decisions and actions. Sometimes you’re lucky and get a large hand of cards you can choose from, and sometimes you have to micromanage and get the best out of a small hand. It’s a game where your luck can change suddenly when the Sandman lashes out, testing your intuition and skills. Will you hide and wait for the attack to blow over, or will you actively attack and escape by the skin of your teeth?
In Sleep Tight you need to constantly be alert and think few steps ahead, as you will need to guess the other players’ next move or even worse, the Sandman’s!

 A video of the gameplay can be seen here: 
WHY KICKSTARTING A PRINT TO PLAY VERSION
This is a sort of a pre-campaign; we would like to polish the rules to their perfection and what better community to do that than the Kickstarter gaming army? Also, Kickstarter is a good way of spreading the word about the game. This is our first game and making waves in the sea of games is hard, but we thought; “Hey, if we show our game to players and they happen to like it then we are all happy.”
We want to get in touch with you and hear your experiences in playing “Sleep Tight” to improve the game and shortcomings we could have missed during tons of playtesting we conducted!
 WHAT DO YOU GET?
After the campaign ends you will get the essentials to play the game; Print To Play PDF version of cards and the rulebook.
“Sleep Tight” currently includes:
96 cards (more than 40 unique cards)
  A PDF Rulebook
  A survey for your comments that we will happily read

Tiny Epic Pirates is a 45 minute, 1-4 player game of high-seas adventure, utilizing a variable RONDEL action system and action combo-ing!
Every player's Rondel is unique, every game!
In Tiny Epic Pirates you take control of a Pirate ship with the goal of burying vast amounts of wealth on secret island hideaways.
Each turn, you move your Captain Token around your ship’s action wheel, selecting which action to perform...
It isn't just other pirates standing in your way of burying treasures! The Royal Navy has their eye on you and the more notorious you become, the more eager they are to stopping your exploits. 
An encounter with the Navy will surely slow your progress, so you best be avoiding them. To do so, you're going to need a good ship and a great crew!
There's a lot of scallywags out there looking for adventure! So assembling your crew won't be very hard, but pulling together a winning crew... that's a different story.
Your crew will play a major role in Tiny Epic Pirates. Each crew member brings different advantages to battle and to the actions you'll take. 
The dice listed at the top of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent what number you'll need to roll to score a hit on another ship! Having multiples of a single number can result in lots of damage, but spreading your numbers out can result in more consistent results. The choice is yours!
The icons listed at the bottom of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent bonus actions that can chain together for epic turns! If the first icon matches your chosen action, you'll get to take the action of the second icon for free.
In addition to your crew, you'll have your reputation and your exploits. As you prove yourself in battle, your legend will grow and so will your ability to command your ship.
Winning battles against other pirates, and against notable merchants, will increase your Legend Level. Each new level offers immediate benefits, as well as increases to your ship's movement and the number of dice you roll in battle.
But enough talk, you're no landlubber. You can learn more about Tiny Epic Pirates by engaging with us in the comments, watching the videos below, or by downloading the rulebook below.

In Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak, rumors of the unthinkable are spreading quickly around the islands. Rumors of dead pirates returning to the sea... aboard an ominous ghost ship helmed by the legendary pirate Amdiak...
Several new game elements are added to play including cursed gold, a ghost ship that haunts the players as they try to steal the cursed gold, ancient relics, haunted map cards and even skeleton crew!
Players gain cursed gold by stealing it from the ghost ship and attacking other pirates who possess it. Cursed gold can be traded for an ancient relic said to hold ashes of Amdiak. Bury this relic and break the Curse of Amdiak!
If the ghost ship finds catches you though, your captain becomes cursed and you lose your cursed gold. Once cursed you will be able to recruit powerful skeleton crew to mindlessly obey your wicked command!
Do you dare to set sail on ghostly waters?

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Pirates to game tables around the world!
