campaign.story:
The Bicycle Distilled Series 
Distilled alcohol has been appreciated around the world since the 12th century. The Bicycle Distilled Playing Card series are beautifully crafted decks that honor the age-old art of producing distilled liquor. These decks are designed and produced by The Well Suited Playing Card Company, and the cards are printed on high-quality Bicycle Classic Grade card stock by The United States Playing Card Company using their famous Air-Cushion finish.
There will be 3 decks in this series - the Bicycle Distilled Copper Edition, the Bicycle Distilled Stainless Edition, and the Bicycle Distilled Top Shelf Edition.
Click images for a high resolution preview
The inaugural deck in this series is the Bicycle Distilled Copper Edition. This breathtaking tuck is printed on a brilliant copper foil stock and finished using a silver rainbow holographic foil. A multi-level, sculpted emboss and deboss take this tuck to the extreme, creating an impressive visual and tactile experience. With an initial run of only 1000 decks, this is a stunning deck that will be a great addition to any collection.
The Well Suited Playing Card Company
The Well Suited Playing Card Company is the brainchild of innovators who have been collectively servicing the playing card industry for more than 30 years. Our desire is simple: to provide the collector and enthusiast alike with an updated take on a traditional craft. We have been working and dreaming for years to create a playing card company that offers innovative design on high-quality decks of collectable playing cards. Our initial offering, the Bicycle Distilled Copper Edition, represents the culmination of these labors.
Quality
The cards will be printed on high-quality Bicycle classic grade card stock by the United States Playing Card Company with the renowned Air-Cushion finish. This guarantees the outstanding handling and performance that only Bicycle cards can deliver.  Each deck will have 56 playing cards and custom tuck box.
The care and craftsmanship that goes into this tuck box cannot be overstated. Each tuck case will be created using multiple layers of foil stamping, printing and multi-level sculpted embossing & debossing to give this tuck a magnificent look and feel.
Card Features:
High quality Bicycle Playing Cards Printed by the United States Playing Card Company with Air-Cushion finish.
52 Poker Size Playing Cards.
Custom illustrated court cards created by local artist Mike Re.
1 Double back card.
2 custom illustrated Jokers created by local artist Mike Re.
1 Ad card.
Tuck Case Features:
Printed with engaging graphics on a custom copper foil stock
Foil stamped with a silver rainbow holographic foil on the outside of the tuck case
Printed graphics on the inside of the tuck case
Embossed & debossed using a multi-level sculpted emboss for an unbelievable three-dimensional look and feel
Engraved Wooden Coasters
Single Deck Engraved Wooden Carrying Case
Engraved Wooden Plaque
Please be aware that all displayed images and options are prototypes. While all the designs and finishing have been vetted and approved, there is the possibility the final product may very slightly from what is seen above. We will be certain to inform you of any changes that are made to the final product.
Thank you for your support!
Visit Well Suited Playing Cards on Facebook
Stretch Goal
If we receive 400% of funding for this project it will unlock a Bicycle Distilled Copper Gilded Edition Deck.

The only foreseeable risk is not getting the campaign funded. If there are any other problems we will make sure to keep backers informed of them through the updates.

----------------ALL STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED----------------
 --------------------THATS 49+ DWARVES!!!---------------------
The Dwarves - 25 miniatures made for 3D printing brought to you by Epics 'N' Stuffs.
Epics 'N' Stuffs is a DnD driven miniature patreon which creates a range of sculpts from varying parts of the lore with their own unique style. The Dwarves have proven to be a popular subject, many have requested that they get brought beyond patreon so this is an effort to remedy that along with some additional rewards/stretch goals.
We also have our own small 3D printing farm and have been selling prints to happy customers for a couple of months, so we want to offer our Dwarves printed to those who might want them.
There are 25 base Dwarves we have created (images below) with the hope to bring more if they prove popular enough. The base set of .STLs offer incredible value which will get greater with the more stretch goals achieved.

Printed physical models come attached to a black base as shown in the images and are printed in either Elegoo or Anycubic Grey resins. Models are on a 32mm base (apart from the Blacksmith who is on a 40mm, stretch goals might also vary).

We utilise a combination of Pixologic Zbrush and Autodesk Maya to create our models, Marmoset Toolbag is used to bring you the model renders and Chitubox Slicer is the software for prepping our 3D printing files.
Once we have a 3D file ready for printing we transfer it via USB to one of our 3D Printers. Our farm consists of several Elegoo Mars' MSLA printers along with a Kelant S400 for larger/bulk prints. Prints take varying amounts of time, to maximise hardware consumable life, as well as printing time, we pack our printbeds with more models as long as it doesn't reduce quality or success rate. We have a range of spare consumables and a supply of resin upfront for incoming work.
Once printed we clean our models using a 2 stage isopropyl clean. Models are then given time to dry before going into an ultrasonic bath in warm water. Once done, we remove supports and then submerge them into water and cure via UV lamps to be sure all the resin is completely solid. Models are given a mild isopropyl rub after they have cured/dried, finally they're glued to a base.
With regards to packaging and delivery, we like to recycle as much as we can so will re-use as much packaging as possible whilst also keeping the models safe. We use a combination of boxes, sponge and padding(like bubble wrap) to ensure models are well protected.
Once the campaign has ended production will begin. .STL files will be sent out for the base models soon after campaign end to those that pledged for them. 
If you have pledged to a physical tier we'll need to know which of the Dwarves you wish to get in your pledge, this can include stretch goal Dwarves that have been made at the time, although the manufacturer of these might delay your order slightly. Once the campaign is over and all the pledges tallied we'll send out a survey asking which models you would like, you can also email - EpicsNStuffs@gmail.com with any questions or queries.
Production on both the stretch goals and physical prints will happen simultaneously. If people would like to purchase additional physical prints of the stretch goals if reached then they will be able to at additional cost. You can add additional models by adding the value of them to your pledge (£10 for 1, £15 for 2, £19 for 3 and £22 for 4). If you do this please send us a message either via the above email or direct PM and we'll add a note to your pledge and reference it once all pledges have been processed.
UPDATES - We'll publish updates to the Kickstarter as and when they're needed prior to the campaign ending as well as keeping people informed on progress once production has began. This campaign will have email: EpicsNStuffs@gmail.com dedicated to it, any communication should come to this email to get a fast reply. 
Shipping costs added when you pledge, nothing else is added once the campaign ends. We have shipped plenty of these miniatures around the world, this is simply how much it costs and includes the packaging and postal charges. 
Estimated delivery for this project is June 2020/July 2020. There may be minor delays caused by factors that are not under our control such as postage delays or customs. We haven't currently experienced this in current store sales but there is always the risk of incidents outside of our control. We would endeavor to keep backers updated via the Kickstarter until all items are delivered.
"Please note the above estimate is based on a prediction we have done, if the KS becomes more successful than I thought this will cause the delivery date to shift."
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The base set of digital files are complete and have been printed by myself, so with regards to the digital base element of the project there is no risk at all. Additional digital stretch goals along with their test printing is also low risk as we have a track record of producing such assets in a timely manner.

We have delivered over 50 physical miniatures via online stores since enabling this feature a little over a month ago and have received brilliant feedback. We have scaled up to accommodate targets outlined in the kickstarter in terms of hardware and consumables needed for printing.

In crowdfunding projects there are always certain variables that could escape the initial plan. As a consequence there is always the possibility of a delay in delivery although delivery estimates for physical items are currently very conservative. These delays are typically caused by last minute additions to the campaign, such as new Stretch Goals, or are a delay within the shipping process itself such as problems with customs releasing the goods, there is always the potential for 3D printer hardware issues however we have spares and the means to purchase additional hardware if required.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Join our Facebook group and don't miss out on the latest updates!
Hidden stretch goal of 87 backers unlocked!
Give your imagination another dimension with 3D print-ready walls, objects, and miniatures!
Bring your tabletop to life! Print and build a castle with multiple floors and custom rooms. Our RPG themed objects will transform your table into a real RPG environment! You will be able to print endless versions of our 55+ different models on your resin or FDM 3D printer.
Note: Rewards will be delivered as digital STL files. They will have different versions (optimized for FDM 3D printers, solid, hollow with drain holes, with or without support).
Click here to read more about this project and it's printed models.
Review by 'No Dice Unrolled'
How does it work?
You print the models and assemble them, Yes it's that easy! Bring your fantasy to life and after an epic game night, disassemble everything so that you can build a new adventure next time!
 Click here to see our new system explained in more detail!
Resin | FDM
Each model will have two versions, one will be suited for 3D printing in resin, and the other will be optimized for FDM printers. This will allow you to choose the option that fits your printer/preference!
The models are in 32mm scale, but they will be easily re-scalable to fit your preference.
Why, back now?
Thre3Dee tabletop is a Kickstarter exclusive project, which means that after the campaign ends, you will not be able to get the STL files anywhere else, not even on our website!
You backing our project today will mean a lot to us! It will not only bring us one step closer to bringing a beautiful open world tabletop RPG - Hidden Galaxy - to Kickstarter but also allow us to leave a splendid first impression!
 Pledge levels (main)
 Go All-In and get all of the above + All Bonus content + All unlocked Stretch goals! 
Bonus content 'Unchained'
We have decided to add random bonus content during the campaign. This will not be linked with the stretch goals! We've already added 12 Bonus STL files to the campaign! 
The mimic is only included in the 'All-IN' pledge.
See more of the wooden door in update #15
Stretch goals
Once unlocked, we will do our best to show you the unlocked stretch goal as fast as possible (+-48h). The unlocked stretch goal will have a tag of the different pledge levels in which it is included.
All stretch goals unlocked!
 A small part of the Hidden Galaxy
As you may already know 'Hidden Galaxy' is the name of our upcoming tabletop RPG project! We wanted to share something from this amazing game and have decided to give every backer the STL file of one of our miniatures for free! 
Your feedback
Feel free to leave your feedback in the project's comment section. Let us know what you like and dislike about the project so that we can make the needed modifications. And deliver high-quality content!
The mimic is one of the examples of the great feedback and ideas we've received and brought to life!
GIF made by 'No Dice Unrolled'
 Time-line
Printing process/troubleshooting
After you receive your files, we will be available in case of problems to troubleshoot you and help you with getting your models printed! This includes printing difficulties, issues with details, or any other!
Kickstarter Goal
Our Kickstarter goal is set to 500 EUR. This is enough to cover the costs of future test-prints and bring you the quality you deserve! The system has already been tested. Now we only need to perform some test prints to optimize the print quality/detail for both Resin and FDM printers.
100% of the project's earnings will be added to the budget of our upcoming Open-world tabletop RPG 'Hidden Galaxy'.
Shipping
We want you to have High-quality print-ready STL files, that's why the delivery date is set for April. After the Kickstarter ends, we will perform more test prints and optimize the models so that they will be easily printable with the highest quality possible.
The delivery will happen trough Dropbox.
About
'No dice unrolled' about Thre3Dee tabletop! Click here to read the article.
About us:
We are an upcoming company named Unchained Games. Some people may know us from Spiel'19 (Essen), where we presented the Alpha of our upcoming open-world tabletop RPG 'Hidden Galaxy'. We wanted to dip our toes in the water and introduce ourselves to the Kickstarter community with a rather smaller project before we went big with a huge (for a first-time creator) project. Since 3D printing and Roleplaying is in our DNA, we came up with the idea of 3D printable RPG components and named it Thre3Dee Tabletop!
The main goal of this project is to gain our first Kickstarter experience and to increase our budget for our upcoming project 'Hidden Galaxy'. Of course, we want to leave an astonishing first impression on our supporters!
About the project:
The main goal of this project is to gain our first Kickstarter experience and to increase our budget for our upcoming project 'Hidden Galaxy'. Of course, we also want to leave an astonishing first impression on You! That's why we promise to do whatever we can to deliver the content and quality you deserve.
Why Kickstarter exclusive? Because we want to concentrate on our main project and not the future marketing and sales of these models. Since this is our first project, we also thought it would be fun to reward our first-ever backers with exclusive content.
About the future of Thre3Dee Tabletop:
During the making of this project, we've had several great ideas and would love to bring you more and even bigger series of Thre3Dee Tabletop in the future!
We strongly believe that together we can start something beautiful! We've already put our soul in these two projects and brought it to this level, putting the future of Unchained Games in your hands!
Team
Special thanks to bensound.com for letting us use their royalty-free music.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are aware that this is our first project, and every 'first' is always a bit tricky.

Everything is successfully tested on a (resin) 3D printer and we are planning to continue testing and optimizing the models both for resin and FDM printers!

Troubles with printing would be the biggest risk. That's why we are doing everything we can to eliminate this risk. Every STL file that we deliver will be test-printed at least thrice before it reaches your inbox! In case your prints don't come out as intended, you will be able to reach out to us and we will do everything in our power to solve the problem.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update for UK, Australia, and Europe Backers
updates.update_content:
Like many of you, we have been anxiously awaiting updates from our fulfillment partner and finally received those updates today and wanted to share those updates for our International backers.  

United Kingdom (fulfilled by ShipQuest)
The UK is finally ready to begin fulfillment this week! All backers should receive their games by March 26th, but we anticipate the majority of UK backers will receive it within the first 5 days of it being shipped.

We are working with our fulfillment company (who is working with other fulfillment companies in other regional hubs) to provide a better update sometime next week, but wanted to share what we've learned and the information we have been chasing down. 

UK Ports have had major delays as a result of Brexit and COVID impacts. Many products (even outside of board games) are being impacted because there's less people to perform the work. campaign.story:
Welcome to "The Empire of Scorching Sands" - a dangerous, and adventure-filled desert environment full of monsters, heroes, magic, and more! 
This Kickstarter provides support-free character and monster miniatures, scatter terrain, buildings, and more for you to produce at home on your FDM or resin 3D printer. Rewards are for digital STL files to print the products shown and described in this campaign. Rewards are split into two categories: Scatter, and Minis - designed to be used together or independently, and all for normal tabletop gaming scale (28-32mm). Even if you don't have plans/need for this specific theme, there's tons of relatively generic stuff in here you can use for all fantasy RPG settings - check it out!
** NEW POTENTIAL BACKERS: Including unlocked stretch goals there are over 65 minis and more than double that in terrain/scenic pieces in this campaign currently. We just unlocked the 18th, and final stretch goal and all models included in the pledges are shown below!
PLEASE NOTE - This Kickstarter is for digital files (STLs) to make all these items on your own home 3D printer - these are not physical goods ** 
Many more pics will be added as the campaign progresses. To see additional pics, check out the full resolution gallery HERE!
---------------------------------------
No 3D gaming table is complete without scatter terrain! This project includes a collection of terrain elements, buildings, and other pieces to fill out your Arabian/Egyptian/Persian cities, palaces, and desert adventure table.  The set ranges from small scatter items to huge multi-floor buildings. All items print support free, and are split/designed/optimized for easy printing, painting, and assembly. The below image shows renders of all the models in some sample configurations included with the scatter & all-in pledge levels, and will be updated as stretch goals are unlocked:
--------------------------------------- 
This project includes a large collection of thematic minis including monsters, beasts, characters, and more!
High-quality miniatures, suitable for resin-level detail but also great quality on FDM printers!
 NO supports are needed for any of these miniatures. This is accomplished by smart posing and design, and slicing/keying where needed.
All models have been test printed and ready to drop on print bed and go.
All minis are included in based versions (pictured below), and also unbased for you to base yourself, use in dioramas, etc. Where split/keyed versions are needed, complete versions are also offered for those that want them.
Minis range from in size from small creatures, to HUGE beasts like the elephant. Scale is roughly 30-32mm (similar in size to Reaper Bones). The below image shows renders of all the models included with the minis & all-in pledge levels, and will be updated as stretch goals are unlocked: 
 As a reminder, ALL miniatures are designed to be 100% support-free on both FDM and resin, and are designed to be easy to print and paint! ZERO supports to setup, sand, cleanup, etc. And because of smart design and angle tolerances, these prints should all require very little, if any,  cleanup and post processing!  
---------------------------------------
We've got LOTS of stretch goals for you! At this point in the campaign ALL 18 stretch goals have been unlocked, and you can see the included/added models in the renders above!
--------------------------------------- 
Outside of the core minis/terrain STLs, I'm throwing in a few pieces of bonus content from previous campaigns that can fit with this theme, to sweeten the pot. After all, who doesn't like free stuff!? I'll also be releasing free props and DungeonSticks as the campaign progresses, which will be updated here and linked to in KS updates. 
You can download the Sun Medallion prop now HERE , the Anubis Ring HERE, and the Magic Lamp HERE. You can also download the free set of mini bases that I created for this campaign HERE
--------------------------------------- 
My name is Evan Carothers, and I am a 3D designer with hundreds of designs released via Thingiverse (ecaroth) and through my premium design company (EC3D). This is my 6th Kickstarter, and any of my thousands of customers can tell you about my track record of easy-to-print models - delivered on time. My skill and love for design has grown out of my passion for tabletop gaming, technology, and 3D printing. I design a  ton of the content myself and work with many other great designers and artists to put these projects together. Take a look at the quality of my free items on Thingiverse or my last campaigns Wilds of Wintertide,  Depths of Savage Atoll or  The Skyless Realms to get a feel for my design aesthetic, or check out some customer reviews. I am a tabletop gamer at heart, and all models are  printed, and often painted, by myself before being released.
Participating Modelers, Artists, Painters, and Printers
Credit to these awesome folks who helped this all come together!
Joshua Black, Sebastiano Di Grazia, Sergio Tomo, Vitaliy Deaf, Crossed Lances, Ben Southall (Yasashii Kyojin Studio), Ryan Calhoun (Cephalopod Studios), David Greenfield (Lidless Eye Studios), & Osaka Zai.
And a SPECIAL thank you to my wonderful girlfriend Ally who has been unbelievably helpful, and essential in preparing this campaign!
Add-ons allow you to get additional awesome stuff at a great discount, and help push even further to unlock stretch goals! To get add-ons, just increase your pledge level by the amount indicated for whichever add-ons you would like. Once the KS closes I will be using a pledge manager (BackerKit) to help you finalize you add-ons. You can increase you pledge on KS now to help fund stretch goals, or get these after the campaign closes. You must back the KS at any of the 3 levels to get add-ons, they are not available individually.
 Wilds of Wintertide: My last sprawling campaign, featuring icy, arctic tundra, terrain/scatter, monsters, and minis - Wilds of Wintertide - the add-ons are equivalent to the what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain/scatter only ($18 add-on), Minis only ($18 add-on), or ALL IN ($25 add-on).
 A Den of Alien Evil - Everything from the first volume of my "Community (Treasure)Chest" series - Mind Horror scenery, terrain, and minis. Check it out the content from the original campaign HERE ($10 add-on).
 Depths of Savage Atoll: A sprawling campaign, featuring nautical, jungle, pirate, and undersea minis and environs - Depths of Save Atoll - the add-ons are equivalent to the what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain/scatter only ($35 add-on), Minis only ($35 add-on), or ALL IN ($65 add-on).
 Skyless Realms: The races and places below the surface, from my previous campaign Skyless Realms  - the add-ons are equivalent to what's included in that campaign (including stretch goals): Terrain only ($40 add-on), Minis only ($35 add-on), or ALL IN ($55 add-on).
 Forest of Oakenspire - Everything from the core reward and stretch goals from my first Kickstarter Forest of Oakenspire at a great discount ($40 add-on).
 All EC3D Premium Sets - The full collection of all 12 previously released premium sets - over $100 value, as seen for sale on Hero's Hoard ($50 add-on)
 Individual EC3D Premium Sets - Chose any number of my EC3D scenery sets from my previously released premium set collection - substantial value over retail price, as seen for sale on Hero's Hoard ($5 per-set add-on)
** Please note ** - all the add-on items above can be purchased right now for a higher price on heroshoard.com or late pledge pages for those campaigns, but if you are willing to wait until this campaign closes to receive the files you can get a great discount AND help unlock more stuff for this current campaign. 
I have an official licensed printer program for my 3D sets, along with my partner at Hero's Hoard, which allows commercial physical resellers with a 10% commission on sales. Anybody can signup for that license, and sell the models from this campaign under that license, and I will not be doing specific merchant tiers for this campaign. So to sell these files (and other non-exclusive EC3D sets) you just need to signup for that resale program and back this campaign to receive the files. 
Everybody hates waiting, and many people have been burned by poorly designed files and broken delivery timelines in previous kickstarters from other vendors. This is not the case with my campaigns. All core models, and many stretch goals, area already finalized and test printed, and nearly ALL FILES will be ready for delivery the second the funds clear after the Kickstarter finishes. I will be finalizing and releasing the remaining items as fast as humanly possible, with a goal of 60 days *MAX* after this Kickstarter ends for delivery - which is something I have successfully done for all my previous Kickstarters.
Disclaimer & Printing Requirements
To get the most out of the printable parts from this Kickstarter, you will need to have a well-tuned 3D printer. For terrain/scatter and FDM printer capable of printing at a minimum .2mm layer height (ideally <= .16mm), such as an Ender 3.  Parts are cut to small pieces to facilitate printing. All designs for terrain are cut and keyed to fit on a 200x200mm print bed.  For minis, a resin printer is ideal and all mini models are cut/keyed (only as needed) to fit on standard sized smaller resin print beds (such as an Anycubic Photon), with the exception of a few VERY large minis. Minis will print on FDM printers as well - for a few of the more challenging models you might need to slow the print down a bit, but no supports will be needed.
Every part is test printed by myself and repaired to be manifold and ready to drop on your slicer - however, In the event that any issues with the files get past my own QA testing and process, and my other test printers, I will make every effort to fix the file and remedy the situation as soon as possible. I use Dropbox for file delivery so I can push updates/fixes. My number one goal is to make some awesome, unique designs you can have a ton of fun with on your tabletop!

You are responsible for following our updates and tracking your shipment. If you do not contact us within 6 months of our update announcing that reward fulfillment has been completed, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received.

When you confirm your pledge, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your reward as entered into our pledge management system and agree that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment. Furthermore, you agree that when shipping to countries other than those specifically listed as being “friendly” (above) you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information, and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

updates.update_content:
I am thrilled to announce that fulfillment is officially starting and being coordinated by Funagain Logistics around the world! When the label for your package is generated, you should receive a tracking number from them or their partners. For any issues with shipping or addresses, please contact help@funagainlogistics.com directly. If for some reason, they cannot resolve your problem, then you can reach out to us.

North America

I will have another update with more details in the next few weeks.  Games have been arriving at ports and I have a lot of emails out there waiting for responses and updates on coordinating everything.  Funagain Logistics emailed me yesterday saying that while the games have been offloaded ships, the North American delivery to our warehouse is now getting pushed to the end of next week due to delays at the container station. The Global Shipping crisis strikes again.  These are all the little logistics types of delays that add up.

Once games have been received, the warehouse and fulfillment partner will typically start packing, printing labels and shipping games.  This is when each backer will receive an email with their tracking information.  It's my experience that this takes around 1-2 weeks to start based on the warehouses specific schedule and other projects.  Once they start, even large projects tend to get all the packages out the door quite quickly. Funagain is doing their best to coordinate all regions to start this process at the same time.

I have much better news to report this month:
Progress Update
Every game finally made it's way out of port and they are all officially on their way to shipping depots.  We've locked and started exporting addresses to our fulfillment partners (and paying shipping deposits) so things can get going as quickly as possible once games start arriving at warehouses.

Progress Update
It's been a pretty frustrating month.  I've never had to wait so long and pay so much for Ocean Freight.  UK BREXIT is also messing things up and I have yet to receive my UK VAT and EORI number despite applying in November. It reminds me how much I hate this phase of the project, because all I can do is send emails and get increasingly frustrated.  The only positive to all of this, is that I've spoken to other publishers and this is a universal problem - one that is rumored to start clearing up after Chinese New Year.  Needless to say, I have never seen these types of delays and inconsistencies in ocean freight before.  Fulfillment may be very disjointed across regions because of this:

Happy New Year everyone!
I hope everyone had a great holiday.  I've been holding out posting an update because I was hoping to have Vessel names for everyone to track. Booking vessels was INCREDIBLY difficult over the holiday season. They're still backlogged and busy.  I did receive an email from the factory this morning  confirming games are all getting picked up and heading to their respective destinations:

updates.update_content:
Production is Complete!
I am happy to report that production is complete and we have received and approved the final production copy:

A few weeks ago, Ryan and I convened to go over the preproduction sample and play some AlderQuest with the Arctic Allies expansion.  It was a lot of fun and the game looked fantastic on the table.  We sent in all our notes and changes to the factory and I am happy to announce that the game will enter full production on October 6th!

Great news! We finally received our Gamecrafter order.  Ryan and I got together so that he could sign them and then we assembled all the prototypes for our Honorary Producers with your signed print of your hero!

Itch.io PNP files
We just sent out emails via itch.io to the current PNP files for the game.  Please check your spam folder.  If you cannot find your download key, please message us on Kickstarter and we can send you a new link.  For anyone stuck at home who is somewhat crafty, we encourage you to check out the current state of the game and send us your feedback.  
Honorary Producers... we're still waiting

updates.update_content: We are officially one week in and I want to thank everyone so far for getting us this far! We hit a new milestone and have passed a third of the way there, we are now at 39% complete! (Everyone that donated please give yourself a pat on the back, we earned this!) We aren't out of this yet and were planning big things in the next couple of weeks so stay tuned and keep letting everyone know about Questicus!

Well, we finally made it to the deadline, and though it didn't hit its goal, I'm still super proud of how far we got. Questicus had a goal of $11,000 and we hit about $7,600, a large chunk of it, but obviously not enough. Does this mean that its officially the end of Questicus? No, definitely not. I plan on working more on it and getting copies of it out in the world. I'm not positive when I will retry it on Kickstarter again, but overall I just wanted to thank all of you for your help and support as we made it to the end. Make sure to follow my Kickstarter profile so that you can be one of the first to hear about what projects will be coming in the future! Thanks again everyone and we will definitely be seeing you around!

- Austin Lopez

We are officially half way there (actually 53 percent)! Thanks to all of you we made it this far and compared to my last project this is going leagues better. With a little over ten days left, let's keep putting the pressure and trying to hit our goal of 11K. With all of your help and those who have are following my project we can definitely get Questicus funded and ready for you all! If you have any questions in regards to the kickstarter, or Questicus, please feel free to message me. Keep on Questing guys!

That's right friends, we just hit 5K in sales on our Kickstarter! We are nearly half way there and I couldn't be more excited! If you haven't pledged yet and are just following the project, please come on in and join us! Questicus needs all the help it can get to be released out in the world! We plan on setting up a special promotion to those who backed as an extra thank you, so if you haven't yet, now should be the time to submit your pledge! Stay tuned guys!

Another milestone today as we continue to reach towards our goal! Today we hit 31% funded! Though this may not seem like a huge milestone to some, I count it as a big victory! Within only 4 days we are nearly a third of the way funded! I couldn't be more excited and thrilled! There's still a ways to go though, so tell your friends and family about Questicus, and lets push forward to 100%!

Day one complete and our new Kickstarter is already at 22 percent complete! It's truly awesome all the effort you guys have put in, but we aren't done yet! If you haven't already, or you are new to our campaign, please help support us with a pledge. We want to hit that $11K goal, and though we've already done fantastic, we don't want to lose momentum either! Spread the word, tell your friends and enemies that Questicus is on Kickstarter! Thank you all and keep on questing!

Welcome back to our relaunch of Questicus! It's been a solid two months and we've worked some fixes and kinks, and have finally returned to Kickstarter! If you have any questions about mechanics, gameplay, or general info, please feel free to message me directly! Thank you all and lets get this game funded!
- Austin Lopez

campaign.story:
The title of king was not simply inherited in the Viking age, you have to fight for it. Enter the Viking age and use the armies of four magnates and chieftains to brawl for the Herrlof: a sign of victory and praise gained in war. Through trick taking and special abilities, you will seek to win just the right amount of power to become the Viking king.
The game consists of rounds, with each round built up of five steps. Each of these steps are set out below. You can also find explanations video’s in several preview videos. An English one here, a Dutch one here and a German one here. 
The dealer deals 15 cards to both players, the remaining 12 cards form a facedown deck on the side of the game.
The dealer then turns the top card of the deck face up, the colour of this card is the trump colour for this round.
Both players take their dealt cards to form their hand and predict how many tricks they think they will win. They write this on their sheet and keep it concealed.
The players then battle for each trick. Tricks are won by players either by having the higher number (if both cards have the same colour), by having a trump coloured card, or by a card with a special power. The 1, 3, 6 and 9 have special powers, allowing you to steal a trick, draft a new card, steal a card or force the other player to start the next trick. It is also possible to destroy a trick altogether with a Valknut-rune card or lose a trick on purpose with the Hagalaz-rune card.
When all dealt cards are played, each player reveals their prediction. You receive one point for each trick you won. If you won the exact number of tricks you predicted, you receive 10 bonus points. If you only won three or four tricks, you receive 5 bonus points (regardless if this was your prediction).
Note that there is a limited-edition luxury edition with an engraved wooden box and gold gilded cards. The game remains the same, but the elements of the game are upgraded. 
Note that we have not included stretch goals that add new elements to the game, we believe the game is complete as it is and adding new elements could break the balance. There are more stretch goals in terms of material available later on.  
NOTE: The shipping is effectively EU and US friendly. For the EU, the value of one or two copies falls below the threshold for taxes. For the US, the value also falls below the threshold and the game will be sent via air freight, thereby effectively reaching a 'friendly' status. 
This project's logistics plan has passed a thorough 7-point review and Floship certifies that we have an efficient and reliable logistics plan to deliver this good from the factory to you, the customers.
We aim for delivery in June as production should finish by late April or early May. However as shipping towards certain destinations takes significant time, we have indicated July and August as delivery dates. During the shipping process you will be kept up to date via updates. 
Local pick up: as we have reached 650 backers, free local pick up is possible in the Netherlands. To switch to this option, please change your pledge to the version with free local pick up (see FAQ for further explanation). The local pick up locations are listed below. If you select local pick up but fail to pick it up here, it will be possible to get your pledge sent to you but this will encure higher shipping charges as it will not be part of the bulk shipment.
Pick up locations:
 Wirwar Spellen en Puzzels, Groningen, during shop hours
 Roll The Dice, Veldhoven, at gaming events in their calendar
 Ducosim conventions, Flint Theater, Amersfoort, if all goes as planned pick up should be possible at the May 16th convention as well as October 10th 
 SpellenSpektakel 2020, Utrecht
Should production be completed as planned, it will be possible to pick up at Zuiderspel on 4 or 5 April 2020. However, this will only be confirmed two weeks before the convention (at which time it will no longer be possible to switch back to shipping). 
There are six standard pledge options provided:
A single copy of Herrlof 
A double copy of Herrlof 
A group pledge (six pack) with six copies of Herrlof 
A luxury limited edition Herrlof 
A Jolly Dutch bundle with Herrlof, Chartered: The Golden Age and Boogie Beasts 
A Jolly Dutch bundle with the Luxury version of Herrlof, and the normal copies of Chartered: The Golden Age and Boogie Beasts.
The luxury version of Herrlof comes in an engraved wooden box and gold gilded cards instead of the standard box and cards. If you would like to receive a normal copy as well, please add €9 to your pledge. 
Herrlof is the third game by Jolly Dutch,  the first being Chartered: The Golden Age and the second Boogie Beasts. We would of course like to offer you the option to pledge for a bundle of all three games combined. That way you save on the recommended retail price and on shipping for all three games. Note that this option is limited as the end of the first print run for both Chartered: The Golden Age and Boogie Beasts is in sight! 
It is possible for retailers to pre-order Herrlof, simply pledge € 1 and send us an email on info@jollydutch.com. For European retailers a VAT number is required. Retailers that pre-order during the campaign will receive the game at the same time as backers. 
Jolly Dutch Productions is a new small game publisher, set up by Alexander and Arnold in the Netherlands. We combine our love for (board) gaming and entrepreneurial spirit to develop new games, specifically looking to bring together families and friends for a jolly evening. We ran our first Kickstarter in October-November 2018: Chartered: The Golden Age, which has been fulfilled.
Inge is the co-author of Herrlof. She grew up disliking board games, having only played Monopoly and always ending the game in an argument. After she was introduced to 'real' board games by her husband, she quickly started to enjoy them and surpassed him in wanting to play. 
Tristam has created all the artwork for Herrlof and the Kickstarter page. He is an independent board game artist and has worked on a number of Kickstarter games. 
The main video was made by Treffend&Co.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have learnt a lot from our previous Kickstarters (succesful and cancelled) and have implemented those leassons in this campaign. 

The artwork and all game elements are ready for production, allowing quick confirmation of the production order and ensuring a smooth start of the production timeline. Additionally, the selected producer has been involved in the process from the start, to ensure all production standards are followed.

Note that refunds after the campaign ends are possible, but this will be minus the Kickstarter and payment fees. Note that for this campaign we will not work with a pledge manager. Note that any backers that fail to complete the information forms concerning shipping addresses ahead of the deadline communicated after the campaign, will be contacted via email twice to allow them to complete the forms. If they still fail to do so, their pledge will not be shipped with the bigger bulk and therefore result in additional shipping costs that will be charged to the backer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
In this high-intensity, deductive game, you’ll work together with your friends to find hidden symbols, piece together clues and arrest a culprit, all in just five minutes! 
You’ll win together. You’ll lose together. But every time, you’ll have fun together.
Easy to pick up and quick to play, 5 Minute Mystery is great for newbie gamers, busy families, and game groups looking for an ice-breaker.
So if you’re ready to cheer as you arrest a frog while a British walrus yells at you, then clear a spot on your games shelf for 5-Minute Mystery! 






We’re incredibly grateful for all the support we get from our Kickstarter backers. We wouldn’t have made it this far without you!
So if you supported either (or both!) of our previous Kickstarter campaigns (5-Minute Dungeon, and Curses! Foiled Again!), we have a special gift for you: a free upgrade to the Mastermind Edition! 
How do you claim this fabulous gift? It’s easy! Here’s how:
Back the project for the Standard Edition. If you managed to get the Early Bird version, that qualifies too!
  After the campaign ends, BackerKit will e-mail you a survey to complete your pledge. If you were a previous backer, your survey will include an offer to upgrade your pledge to the Mastermind Edition for free.
  Click “YES!” and grab a pipe and deerstalker cap. You’re now a Mastermind!
  Limit one free upgrade per returning backer.
No problem! Each game you add to your pledge will be at the regular pledge price, plus a nominal $5 CDN shipping charge per extra game. Just add the amount when you make your pledge. 
 Add Standard Editions: +$40 CDN for each additional copy (This includes shipping costs)
 Add Mastermind Editions: +$50 CDN for each additional copy (This includes shipping costs)
Please note that only one Early Bird discount and one Returning Backer Gift can be applied per pledge. Additional copies are at regular price.


For this campaign, we've decided to focus on community involvement rather than stretch goals. We wanted to make sure that no matter how funding turned out you got everything we envisioned for this game: upgraded materials, extra scene cards, more suspects & culprits, and plenty of additional case files to keep the game fresh. Everything that we were planning as stretch goals have already, automatically, been included in each copy of the game!
So instead, we've got some great stuff planned: several polls so you can help to shape the finished game, sneak peeks at game content and components, and contests to win cool prizes!
Once again, we're partnering with BackerKit to make it much easier for backers to manage their pledge choices and shipping information at the end of the campaign.
When the campaign ends, you'll receive a BackerKit survey asking you to provide your shipping information so we can get your rewards to you. As part of this survey, you'll have the opportunity to add more copies of the game at regular price plus $5 shipping per additional game.
We are partnering with depots in the USA, Canada, Europe, China, and Australia to minimize the chances of additional duty and taxes being charged to you. Shipping to areas outside these regions may result in additional charges out of our control. Please research import regulations to learn about these potential costs for your country before  placing an order.
Each pledge must be shipped to a single delivery address. Unfortunately, we cannot split pledges to ship to multiple addresses.
Currency Conversions
Remember that your pledge is in Canadian Dollars, and your card will be billed in Canadian Dollars when the campaign ends. Currency exchange rates change regularly. Look at your local currency exchange rate toward the end of the campaign for the most  current price.
Special Thanks

Video production provided by our friends at Brick House Productions.

campaign.story:
Air Deck 3.0 - Cool playing cards for travelers
Our mission is to make the ultimate travel playing cards. After the success of our first two Air Deck and three Nanobag campaigns, and more than 37k backers later, we’re now ready for our sixth campaign.  
The Air Deck that shuffles and handles like you expect professional cards to do
 Created with feedback from the community, here are our seven new designs: 
Our 7 designs: Red Classic, Electric, Night Sky, Aqua Mandala, Geometric, Retro and Blue Classic
Check out some of the feedback we've received from our Air Deck 2.0 backers.
52 Playing Cards + 2 jokers
Waterproof and washable
Compact travel friendly size
Lightweight
Durable heavy-duty 'casino quality' 0.31mm PVC
Premium printing
Slightly textured on both sides for better handling
Sturdy 0.4mm waterproof synthetic paper tuck box
Playing card size : 3.43 x 1.26 inches (87 x 32mm)

PS. When pledging, just select the number of decks you want. You get to choose which designs you want in the backer survey we send out after the campaign is over.  
Our mission is to create the ultimate playing cards for travelers
The Air Deck 3.0 takes up very little space and easily fits into your pocket
Air Deck 3.0 is made with the same high-quality materials as the original, but there’s a few new things:
Five fresh new designs voted on by our community.
The boxes now have indents to make them easier to open.
We'll be planting even more mangrove trees to offset our emissions many times over. We believe being a climate positive company is important. 1 tree gets planted for every two decks sold.

Five fresh new designs voted on by our community
The boxes now have an indent to make them easier to open

Thank you for helping us reach both our stretch goals!
With the Air Deck 3.0 we did not want to compromise on quality. We went to several of the world’s best manufacturers of premium casino cards and asked for the best materials they could provide. In the process of creating the ultimate travel deck, we tried out over 50 different high-end plastic materials. The materials were taken through scratch, bending and handling tests to identify the best candidate. Finally, we ended up with a premium ‘casino quality’ PVC that has all the properties we want for our deck.    
The Air Deck 3.0 is meticulously cut
The Air Deck is made of a casino quality PVC
 The Air Deck is incredibly resistant to tearing and bending, and is 100% waterproof. You can play with these in the pool, in the boat, in the tub, in the rain, at the beach, pretty much wherever you can think of. 
While regular paper playing cards tear, stain, and break easily, Air Deck 3.0 is extremely durable
The cards are 100% waterproof, so you can use them in the pool, bathtub or even the beach.
You can also wash the cards.

The cards are slightly textured on both sides to provide cushioning and excellent handling
In the process of selecting the material we sought advice from several playing card professionals. The end result is a deck that shuffles and handles like you expect professional cards to do. The cards are slightly textured on both sides to provide cushioning and excellent handling. 
The Air Deck 3.0 shuffles easily

We created the new designs for Air Deck 3.0 with the wonderful supportive feedback we’ve received from our community. Despite their smaller width, the cards are as easy to read as standard sized decks. The full-sized length ensures that they also handle much like regular cards, and the narrower width makes the deck fit nicely in the palm of your hands.
The narrower width makes the deck fit nicely in the palm of your hands
Blue Classic, Aqua Mandala, Night Sky and Red Classic comes with traditional looking face cards, while Retro, Geometric and Electric has a more minimalistic look: 
Our face card designs

Each deck consists of 52 standard playing cards and 2 jokers

We love traveling this beautiful blue ball we call home, and we believe we should care for it as best we can. There’s only one planet earth after all. We consider the Air Deck 3.0 to be an environmentally conscious product to begin with, as it contains half the materials of its competitors, and is made of durable materials which provides a long product life. However, with this campaign we’ve upped our commitment to the planet by planting one mangrove tree for every two decks sold with our tree planting partner, Eden Reforestation Projects.
Mangrove trees are one of the most effective tools to bind CO2 to the soil, thus preventing it from escaping into the atmosphere. A mangrove tree can sequester up to a ton of carbon dioxide by the time it reaches 40 years old. As a bonus, they also help sustain coastal ecosystems, protect shorelines from damage by storms and acts as a filter to maintain water quality.
We will plant mangrove trees with Eden Reforestation Projects

The idea for the original Air Deck was conceived by fellow globetrotters Ursus Negenborn and Rune Kippervik while traveling South East Asia. We love playing cards, and we just couldn’t find a deck that was perfect for carrying at all times. As we’re big fans of optimization, we decided to create the ultimate playing cards for travelers ourselves.
The Air Deck founders

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 950+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $400M raised between them.
Promoted by Palm Tree Digital, the marketing power behind some of the most successful crowdfunding campaigns of 2019. Cutting edge Kickstarter, Indiegogo, and E-commerce marketing.
campaign.risks:

The designs of the cards have been finalized, and we’ve made the prototypes you see in the video. Since this is our third project, we’ve ironed out the kinks, and we feel confident that we can deliver a great product. Logistics has already been worked thoroughly out, and we will ship tracked to all customers, to ensure a reliable delivery. Our factory is standing by, and will start production as soon as we are funded. As with any project, unforeseen events can occur, but we've done everything we can to keep unknown factors to a minimum. As we are continuously improving our products, there could be minor adjustments to the decks seen in the video.

campaign.story:
Cards for Math!
Explore a brave new world of knowledge
Our educational system has been giving a hard time to kids when it comes in learning Mathematics. Teachers trying to create challenging tutoring sessions for students constantly fail in getting them interested in math, using the old traditional way.
Math cards are a promising project
We are dedicated in providing students with a great way to learn math and be introduced in the magic of numbers. In this project we have the ambition to create high-quality cards that depict all the numbers as well as the signs of the basic arithmetic exercises and the equations.
After years of teaching math in a vast variety of schools, it has been shown that students are always bored of this lesson. The electronic calculators are putting barriers to the educational procedure since students cannot feel the touch of real numbers.
This project has been carefully planned to create a series of cards that will be given to you so that teaching math can become an easy and entertaining task. Given that children like to play cards, their vivid appearance will get them interested in knowing and touching each number combined with equation signs, square roots and arithmetic exercises signs.
We are ambitious enough to believe that this method will securely introduce young students to the basic principles of math and make them consider it like a game. Years of in class experience would be in your hands to use it while teaching math to your own children or students.

We are eager to produce high quality cards for math tutoring. We also need your help to get this project done and diminish the number of the math illiterate kids around the world.

campaign.story:
Zombie Run was developed as an answer to the question, "What is the opposite of a race game?" In Zombie Run, rather than trying to be the first one around the board, your goal is to be the last one to lose.
In Zombie Run you will be running away from a horde of zombies. You will have a team of four characters with different strengths, weakness and abilities which will affect how effective they are at moving along the road. Every game is fairly unpredictable as you do your best to deal with the obstacles along the road and random events which happen each round.

The game comes with:
1 deck of road cards, 
1 deck of event cards,
1 deck of ability cards,
4 sets of 6 characters,
6 dice.

Game details:
4 Players
30-45 minutes
Age 10+

Below is a short explanation of the rules and a demo round.
PLAY

We have been play testing for about 6 month and have made many changes to streamline the flow of play. We are still tweaking some of the cards and abilities to ensure that no specific effects are imbalanced.

With the basics out of the way, the cards have been designed to give strong visual cues to tie into the theme. So with the card shown below, we display a circus tent to show this is where the carnie rummages for additional supplies (ability card).
The card below shows that the road has been overrun letting you know that certain characters will have a tough time traversing it.
A stop sign indicates that a certain type of character needs to stop.
If you are clever in the way you move your characters and use your ability cards you can minimize the impact of these negative movement modifiers and ensure your characters have a slightly longer life than the others.
The character also have different ability cards they can use to match their theme. The medic can prevent bad things from happening to your characters and the burglar can make things more difficult for your opponent.
Finally, some cards affect the Zombies. The below card is an example. There is a fence spanning the road which prevents the Zombies from moving past that tile that round. I assume Zombies would have trouble with fences.
If you like what you see please support us.

campaign.story:
This game is funded to create some amazing artwork, a great solo experience focusing on guiding you to get in the mood for some adventuring that can be done over multiple game sessions in a dynamically shifting dark-fantasy world.  
Here's some drafts of the kind of style we would like for the game: 
 The game itself is a simplistic minimalist board game with a lot of focus on keeping the information level down while leaving room for your imagination using keywords and a reference sheet instead. It consists of only 10 dice, 53 cards (split into 4 different decks), a reference sheet, 3 different tokens as well as a double deck wooden box with an engraved motive for those nights were you want a special treat, giving yourself a gift of some medieval story-telling and adventuring. 
A playthrough of the prototype: 
The rulebook (Here's a pdf: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ToY5evc88sWj8qZA1xHKtVbtvpYDHsjI): 
Here's some additional drafts of the card-layout of the game (all 54 cards have drafts to be made into actual art once the project is funded) which will be manufactured in poker-sized cards of professional standard card stock with blue core (smooth finish):
 Three different 20 mm tokens (peddlers goods, rations & gold) to keep it simple:
For visual clarity we're including 10 single-sided 14 mm wooden die:
(Project-image as well as this render made by Toni Marchev, found at: https://bai-marcko.artstation.com/)
This is the kind of wooden double-decked box we're having in mind (with a single engraved star on it): 
 Northern Star - Solitaire rewards memorizing due to the low amount of cards, that instead varies greatly in their content. A focus have been given to only keep content that feels fun and essential to the game. A special feature is that you can save your character and progress after a game session, so as to be continued at a later time. For each game-session you will have an objective that will have permanent negative consequences if not resolved - your character may survive and improve but the world will grow darker until all objectives are resolved. 
Lastly I see the project having potential for some great solitaire experiences since this have been developed and playtested the past four years, and is now subject for a board game contest on Boardgamegeek for blind playtesting.
I have access to 3D-printers, laser-cutters, sketch-studios, 2 different organisations for game-testing and both contacts and an online group with extensive experience in regards to game design and business management.
My name is Pär, I'm a 28 year old product design student who have just graduated, currently living in the northern parts of Sweden. I have developed several games before (both digital and analog), but this is my first published game. Boardgames I have designed have mostly been in the cooperative categories where as I made one for my product design degree (with a lot of focus on story-telling, simple rules and deep immersion). I enjoy Sherlock Holmes: Consultive detective and Arkham horror, Tiny Epic Quest and Battlestar Galactica among others. I'm quite a creative person who've been playing games my entire life, studied business management, been in start-ups before through business incubators and also like creative arts such as drawing and playing music. 
Kristian here, also living in the northern parts of Sweden. I've been interested in boardgames sinces I was little and studied game design at Gothenburg University. The intent I have with this project is to be a part of the game creating team and making sure you get your well deserved answers to your questions on our social media sites. 
Feel free to contact us through:
Facebook: @LightInDarknessOfficial or fb.me/LightInDarknessOfficial 
Instagram: lightindarknessofficial
Email: lightindarknessofficial@gmail.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I see this as a test to see how big the audience can be for solitaire board games. The goal of SEK 317,500 can be quite a challenge to reach, requring +1700 backers which we will try to overcome through extensive marketing on different social media platforms and sending out additional promotional videos. If you find Northern Star intriguing, feel free to spread the word about it. 

In regards to artwork I find artists can be quite expensive, but due to the simplistic yet beautiful motives this may reduce their cost. A potential risk is that the game may not find an illustrator that will make the game as beautiful as I intend making it, and also that the costs may surpass budget. However there are still margins in the funding goal if this would happen, so as to making the game a reality.

The game (and components) are truly simplistic and we have already got a qoute on manufacturing and shipping costs, so I see no real problems that can't be overcome. Especially with my past experience in regards to start-ups. However I see potential risks with distribution and perhaps not having illustrations as beautiful as intended.

Board game distribution and logistics: One of the biggest risks is that difficulty due to lacking experience in the board game distribution sector and creating a pipe-line for distribution will delay the shipping-process of the game, however I have good supplier contacts which handles both supply and shipping. I also have great contacts and friends within the University business developers sector who could give guidance if needed. 

Some mechanics may be flawed due to not enough game-testing, although the game being the result of almost 4 years of individual playtesting culminating into one simplistic concept. The game have entered a solitaire board game contest for additional blind-tests, and is continually playtested in addition to designing artwork, updating and marketing our Kickstarter.

campaign.story:
Being a Grim Reaper, you assemble Pombie corps and collect souls to compete with other Grim Reapers! A great card game for Halloween!
Pombies is a card game for two to four players. It is a simplified version of Japanese Mahjong, and is a family game for kids to join!
(Pledge around €26/US$29=HK$230. Pledge goal around €3,400/US$3,800=HK$30,000)
Overview
Pombies in a Hong Kong street
In a dark world of modern time, you are one of the Grim Reapers collecting poor souls while guiding them to the afterlife. You are not the only Grim Reaper seeking souls across this world. Rival Grim Reapers are always competing with you to get more souls, even if it means taking them from you!
You have the power to collect and order Pombies to work for your purpose. By assembling your Pombies, you devise a strategy to get the most souls and become the best Grim Reaper!
Each player is given nine cards in the beginning. You need to keep drawing and discarding cards to form certain combinations according to the score sheet. The winner needs to be the first to collect three sets of three cards of the same type restricted by prewritten combinations.
Each player plays against every player. There’s only one winner in each game.

Where the project idea comes from...
You must have heard of Mahjong, a very popular and indulging tabletop game in most Asian countries. It’s a classic game, a must-have furniture (Mahjong table) for families, and a popular community activity in festive time such as New Year and certainly everyday life.
Mahjong has become so popular over a millennium in its history. Having been around for a very long time, the game is very well-established and even considered as an addiction for some people.
Not surprisingly, Japanese have developed their own ways of playing Mahjong. Based on the traditional Japanese Mahjong gameplay, Japanese re-invented a simplified variation of Japanese Mahjong called Pomjong, which is rather casual, fun, and has become a very popular family game widely circulated and played in Japan for decades. Our creator played it in Japan, and believed it should be introduced to the whole world. Pomjong has actually extended the idea of “pom” (ポン), one of the major actions in both Japanese and Chinese Mahjong, and has made itself a family game simple and enjoyable enough for kids to join. Our game, Pombies, is inspired by the Japanese Pomjong and will make itself a very unique and fun game for your families and communities.
ぽんびーず means Pombies.
The idea of controlling a team of zombie corps to work for your purpose is absolutely fun. Imagine if you can order hundreds of zombies to help in a battle, you shouldn’t need any other weapon. The Pombies in this game have different physical features and special innate skills from their own species.
Yes, what we have here, are good Pombies. They are in four categories and take unique roles by their innate features. They are Catbies, Humbies, Dolbies, and Fairbies. They are what they are reflected in their names.
Game Box Content
How the game is played...
In Mahjong, people use block tiles imprinted with patterned symbols. Mahjong game sets are normally bulky, heavy and noisy during the play. In Pombies, we use cards to make the game more accessible for playing in any location! Using cards instead of plastic block tiles is a handy solution to reduce noise, therefore no more complaints from your neighbors about loud noise made during game time anymore!
The gameplay of Pombies is very different from Mahjong. Here is how this game is played:
How the game starts...
Each player plays against everyone else. Each player is given nine cards in hand to start with. The winner needs to be the first to collect three sets of three cards of the same type restricted by prewritten combinations. There’s only one winner in each game.
Only you should see your cards during the game. You may guess what Pombies your rivals are after, and keep those from them, at the same time, assemble your Pombie combination to win the game based on the prewritten combinations on the score sheet you are targeting. What you should target should be based on the nine cards you draw in the beginning of the game.
Souls
While Mahjong usually involves money, Pombies involves souls.
Pombies is a point-based game. Points are represented in the form of soul tokens. There are 3 types of soul tokens. Each player starts with 1000 souls. The objective of the game is to obtain the highest amount of souls when the game ends.
One Executive/Parent player and Attendants/Children players
Now everyone should have 1000 souls. Each player rolls two dice to decide who is the “Executive/Parent” player. (It is called “Parent” in Japanese Mahjong. Using it when playing with family members will increase fun level.)
The player with the highest dice roll becomes the “Executive/Parent”, and the other three becomes “Attendants/Children”. (It is called “Children” in Japanese Mahjong.)
While being “Executive/Parent”, the player enjoys several benefits and earns more souls than usual. If you are the “Executive/Parent”, try to keep the position as long as possible! If you are not, take down the “Executive/Parent” by any means necessary!
How the rounds start...
The round starts from the “Executive/Parent” player drawing the top card from the pile. After drawing the top card, the “Executive/Parent” player must discard one of the cards and keep only eight cards in hand. Each discarded card should be placed in front of the player, from left to right, in order.
Then, the next player in clockwise order performs the same action.
Players continue to take turns until all cards are drawn or a player completes a combination.
Pombies on the attack!
One of the unique gameplay elements of Pombies is that players can use their own discarded cards to tip the game in their favor!
During any moment of the round, the player can spend 3 cards of the same character from his/her discarded pile. This triggers a special action, which is unique for each Pombie species. For example, spending 3 Catbies cards will allow the player to steal the latest discarded card from another player. The player should shout “Catbies!” while doing so to declare the action!
Winning
When you are only missing one card to complete the combination, you may place the last discarded card sideways, and declare “Reach!”.
The player who declares “Reach!” must bet a 10-soul token in the middle as a “Reach!” mark.
After this, the player who has declared “Reach!” cannot change his cards until the round is over. (Only cards taken from the center pile can be discarded.)
The player can complete the combination through drawing the last card from the center pile, or when another player discards the last card. When this happens the player can shout “Pombies!” and becomes the winner.
If nobody wins the round, then all 10-soul tokens in the middle will be kept for the next round. Good luck!
(Game rule details will be written in the Rulebook which is in development.)
About Spherewalker
We are from Hong Kong, a highly multi-national city. Our core creator, who was born in Tokyo, Japan, raised in Hong Kong, has a true heart of making games which can discover Asian elements in terms of aesthetics and gameplay.
Shipping
We hope to deliver the game to everyone no later than April 2020.
The games will be sent out from China to the backers’ addresses.
The shipping fee is requested on Kickstarter when you pledge.
Backers will be responsible for any import fees, VAT, duties, taxes, post office fees, and/or any other fees their countries impose.
After the campaign, we will send backers a survey from Kickstarter to obtain all shipping addresses and pledge information.
If there’s any issue, please raise within 2 weeks of receiving the product, otherwise the tracking record expires and we can only assume it has been delivered. We will not be able to refund a month after the date the tracking number has been issued.
Any refund will have the Kickstarter fee (5%) and credit card charge (3% + small fee) deducted.

campaign.story:
Wolves of Mercia is a game of deception and strategy, set in the dark fantasy village of Mercia. But in this town, the villagers don't wait helplessly to be slaughtered by the werewolf. Each must deploy their unique abilities in order to fulfill their own hidden agenda! Whether torching the village, tracking the werewolf by night, or completing a fearful eldritch ritual, 5-16 players will lie, bluff, and kill to seize the night.
During the day, you pretend to be ordinary. Trading goods as a merchant, studying ancient lore as a scholar, or taking confession as a priest. But when night falls, you drop the facade and work toward your own secret agenda. Perhaps you are an initiate of a sinister cult, working with your fellows to usher untold destruction. Or perhaps you prefer the arsonist's insane fantasy of torching half the village...
Put plainly, Wolves of Mercia features:
A refreshing reinterpretation of the social deduction genre
A small footprint with a tight 30-45 minute run time
Unique, asymmetric win conditions for every player
No player elimination!
 For those who would like to read the rules for themselves, click here (PDF).
We originally planned Wolves of Mercia as a small boutique release. A lean and lightweight project between major releases. But then we took the game to Gen Con.
Situated in a game store just a block off the main Gen Con drag, we played dozens upon dozens of games of Wolves of Mercia with groups of five to sixteen eager players, and we felt something special brewing...
The game was infectious. So infectious that players wanted to run it back and immediately play another game. So infectious that players came back day after day to play again because they hadn't stopped thinking about it overnight. So infectious indeed that by the final day we had players from the first day running extra game tables for us!
After a wild couple days at Gen Con, what was going to be a small release for us was suddenly getting retailer attention. With the realization that we have something special on our hands, we're turning to Kickstarter to expose our game to a larger audience and raise funds for a larger print run.
What's great about this campaign is that Wolves of Mercia is in an advanced stage of development slated for a late October/early November release. We've prototyped, play tested, and have final assets in place for all components. There will be much less waiting than a typical Kickstarter. We'll need a few weeks for production, and a further few weeks for fulfillment, that's it!
Each set of of Wolves of Mercia contains:
A full deck of tarot-sized cards with hand-illustrated artwork
17 character roles, 18 secret roles, 4 phantoms, and special character action cards including eldritch cultist rituals
A hand-illustrated, small footprint gameboard with a premium light-diffusing linen finish
Hardy punchboard skill tokens and red wooden counters
A robust, story-rich 35-page instruction manual
As a bonus to all Kickstarter backers, every copy of Wolves of Mercia will ship with a small thank you note that includes a code to download the exclusive Print & Play Character The Emissary. A newcomer to Mercia, he's here to make some dirty deals on behalf of an unknown master.
Update: Every copy of Wolves of Mercia will ship with a professionally printed bonus character The Emissary--no more need to print it yourself!
